to numeros 1, 4 & 16 pro V; & prodibit arcuum differentia
(1/2/121)=A+B+C in ca&longs;u &longs;ecundo; (2/35 1/2)=4A+8B+16C in ca&longs;u
quarto; & (8/9 2/3)=16A+64B+256C in ca&longs;u &longs;exto.

Et ex his æ­
quationibus, per debitam collationem & reductionem Analyticam,
fit A=0,0000916, B=0,0010847, & C=0,0029558. E&longs;t igitur
differentia arcuum ut 0,0000916V+0,0010847V1/2+0,0029558V2:
& propterea cum (per Corollarium Propo&longs;itionis XXX) re&longs;i&longs;tentia
Globi in medio arcus o&longs;cillando de&longs;cripti, ubi velocitas e&longs;t V,
&longs;it ad ip&longs;ius pondus ut (7/11)AV+(16/23)BV1/2+1/4CV2 ad longitudinem
Penduli; &longs;i pro A, B & C &longs;cribantur numeri inventi, fiet re&longs;i&longs;tentia
Globi ad ejus pondus, ut 0,0000583V+0,0007546V1/2+0,0022169V2
ad longitudinem Penduli inter centrum &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis & Regulam,
id e&longs;t, ad 121 digitos.

Unde cum V in ca&longs;u &longs;ecundo de&longs;ignet 1,
in quarto 4, in &longs;exto 16: erit re&longs;i&longs;tentia ad pondus Globi in ca&longs;u
&longs;ecundo ut 0,0030298 ad 121, in quarto ut 0,0417402 ad 121, in
&longs;exto ut 0,61675 ad 121.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Arcus quem punctum in filo notatum in ca&longs;u &longs;exto de&longs;crip&longs;it,
erat 120-(8/9 2/3) &longs;eu (119 5/29) digitorum.

Et propterea cum radius e&longs;&longs;et
121 digitorum, & longitudo Penduli inter punctum &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis
& centrum Globi e&longs;&longs;et 126 digitorum, arcus quem centrum Globi
de&longs;crip&longs;it erat (124 1/31) digitorum.

Quoniam corporis o&longs;cillantis ve­
locitas maxima, ob re&longs;i&longs;tentiam Aeris, non incidit in punctum infi­
mum arcus de&longs;cripti, &longs;ed in medio fere loco arcus totius ver&longs;atur:
hæc eadem erit circiter ac &longs;i Globus de&longs;cen&longs;u &longs;uo toto in Medio
non re&longs;i&longs;tente de&longs;criberet arcus illius partem dimidiam digitorum
(62 1/62), idQ.E.I. Cycloide, ad quam motum Penduli &longs;upra reduxi­
mus: & propterea velocitas illa æqualis erit velocitati quam Glo­
bus, perpendiculariter cadendo & ca&longs;u &longs;uo de&longs;cribendo altitudinem
arcus illius &longs;inui ver&longs;o æqualem, acquirere po&longs;&longs;et.

E&longs;t autem &longs;inus
ille ver&longs;us in Cycloide ad arcum i&longs;tum (62 1/62) ut arcus idem ad pen­
duli longitudinem duplam 252, & propterea æqualis digitis 15,278.
Quare velocitas ea ip&longs;a e&longs;t quam corpus cadendo & ca&longs;u &longs;uo &longs;pa­
tium 15,278 digitorum de&longs;cribendo acquirere po&longs;&longs;et.

Tali igitur
cum velocitate Globus re&longs;i&longs;tentiam patitur, quæ &longs;it ad ejus pondus
ut 0,61675 ad 121, vel (&longs;i re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ pars illa &longs;ola &longs;pectetur quæ
e&longs;t in velocitatis ratione duplicata) ut 0,56752 ad 121.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Experimento autem Hydro&longs;tatico inveni quod pondus Globi hu­
jus lignei e&longs;&longs;et ad pondus Globi aquei magnitudinis eju&longs;dem, ut 55
ad 97: & propterea cum 121 &longs;it ad 213,4 in eadem ratione, erit
re&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi aquei præfata cum velocitate progredientis ad ip­
&longs;ius pondus, ut 0,56752 ad 213,4 id e&longs;t, ut 1 ad (376 1/50). Unde cum
pondus Globi aquei, quo tempore Globus cum velocitate unifor­
miter continuata de&longs;cribat longitudinem digitorum 30,556, veloci­
tatem illam omnem in Globo cadente generare po&longs;&longs;et; manife&longs;tum
e&longs;t quod vis re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ eodem tempore uniformiter continuata tol­
lere po&longs;&longs;et velocitatem minorem in ratione 1 ad (376 1/50), hoc e&longs;t, ve­
locitatis totius partem (1/(376 1/50)). Et propterea quo tempore Globus,
ea cum velocitate uniformiter continuata, longitudinem &longs;emidiame­
tri &longs;uæ, &longs;eu digitorum (3 7/16), de&longs;cribere po&longs;&longs;et, eodem amitteret mo­
tus &longs;ui partem (1/3342).

Numerabam etiam o&longs;cillationes quibus Pendulum quartam mo­
tus &longs;ui partem ami&longs;it.

In &longs;equente Tabula numeri &longs;upremi deno­
tant longitudinem arcus de&longs;cen&longs;u primo de&longs;cripti, in digitis & par­
tibus digiti expre&longs;&longs;am: numeri medii &longs;ignificant longitudinem ar­
cus a&longs;cen&longs;u ultimo de&longs;cripti; & loco infimo &longs;tant numeri o&longs;cilla­
tionum.

Experimentum de&longs;crip&longs;i tanquam magis accuratum quam
cum motus pars tantum octava amitteretur.

Calculum tentet qui
volet.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Po&longs;tea Globum plumbeum, diametro digitorum 2, & pondere
unciarum Romanarum26 1/4, &longs;u&longs;pendi filo eodem, &longs;ic ut inter cen­
trum Globi & punctum &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis intervallum e&longs;&longs;et pedum 10 1/2,
& numerabam o&longs;cillationes quibus data motus pars amitteretur.
Tabularum &longs;ub&longs;equentium prior exhibet numerum o&longs;cillationum
quibus pars octava motus totius ce&longs;&longs;avit; &longs;ecunda numerum o&longs;cil­
lationum quibus eju&longs;dem pars quarta ami&longs;&longs;a fuit.

In Tabula priore &longs;eligendo ex ob&longs;ervationibus tertiam, quintam
& &longs;eptimam, & exponendo velocitates maximas in his ob&longs;erva­
tionibus particulatim per numeros 1, 4, 16 re&longs;pective, & genera­
liter per quantitatem V ut &longs;upra: emerget in ob&longs;ervatione tertia
(1/2/193)=A+B+C, in quinta (2/90 1/2)=4A+8B+16C, in &longs;eptima
(8/30)=16A+64B+256C. Hæ vero æquationes reductæ dant
A=0,001414, B=0,000297, C=0,000879. Et inde prodit re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia Globi cum velocitate V moti, in ea ratione ad pondus &longs;uum
unciarum 26 1/4, quam habet 0,0009V+0,000207V1/2+0,000659V2
ad penduli longitudinem 121 digitorum.

Et &longs;i &longs;pectemus eam &longs;o­
lummodo re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ partem quæ e&longs;t in duplicata ratione velocitatis,
hæc erit ad pondus Globi ut 0,000659V2 ad 121 digitos.

Erat au­
tem hæc pars re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ in experimento primo ad pondus Globi
lignei unciarum (57 7/22), ut 0,002217V2 ad 121: & inde fit re&longs;i&longs;tentia
Globi lignei ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam Globi plumbei (paribus eorum velocita­
tibus) ut (57 7/22) in 0,002217 ad 26 1/4 in 0,000659, id e&longs;t, ut 7 1/3 ad 1.
Diametri Globorum duorum erant 6 7/8 & 2 digitorum, & harum
quadrata &longs;unt ad invicem ut 47 1/4 & 4, &longs;eu (11 11/16) & 1 quamproxime.
Ergo re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ Globorum æquivelocium erant in minore ratione
quam duplicata diametrorum.

At nondum con&longs;ideravimus re&longs;i-
&longs;tentiam fili, quæ certe permagna erat, ac de pendulorum inventa
re&longs;i&longs;tentia &longs;ubduci debet.

Hanc accurate definire non potui, &longs;ed
majorem tamen inveni quam partem tertiam re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ totius mi­
noris penduli; & inde didici quod re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ Globorum, dempta
fili re&longs;i&longs;tentia, &longs;unt quam proxime in duplicata ratione diametro­
rum.

Nam ratio 7 1/3-1/3 ad 1-1/3, &longs;eu 10 1/2 ad 1, non longe abe&longs;t a
diametrorum ratione duplicata (11 11/16) ad 1.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Cum re&longs;i&longs;tentia fili in Globis majoribus minoris &longs;it momenti,
tentavi etiam experimentum in Globo cujus diameter erat 18 1/4 di­
gitorum.

Longitudo penduli inter punctum &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis & cen­
trum o&longs;cillationis erat digitorum 122 1/2, inter punctum &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis
& nodum in filo 109 1/2 dig. Arcus primo penduli de&longs;cen&longs;u a no­
do de&longs;criptus, 32 dig. Arcus a&longs;cen&longs;u ultimo po&longs;t o&longs;cillationes
quinque ab eodem nodo de&longs;criptus, 28 dig. Summa arcuum &longs;eu
arcus totus o&longs;cillatione mediocri de&longs;criptus, 60 dig. Differentia
arcuum 4 dig. Ejus pars decima &longs;eu differentia inter de&longs;cen&longs;um &
a&longs;cen&longs;um in o&longs;cillatione mediocri 2/5 dig. Ut radius 109 1/2 ad radi­
um 122 1/2, ita arcus totus 60 dig. o&longs;cillatione mediocri a nodo de­
&longs;criptus, ad arcum totum 67 1/8 dig. o&longs;cillatione mediocri a centro
Globi de&longs;criptum: & ita differentia 2/5 ad differentiam novam 0,4475.
Si longitudo penduli, manente longitudine arcus de&longs;cripti, augere­
tur in ratione 126 ad 122 1/2; tempus o&longs;cillationis augeretur & velo­
citas penduli diminueretur in ratione illa &longs;ubduplicata, maneret
vero arcuum de&longs;cen&longs;u & &longs;ub&longs;equente a&longs;cen&longs;u de&longs;criptorum diffe­
rentia 0,4475. Deinde &longs;i arcus de&longs;criptus augeretur in ratione
(124 1/31) ad 67 1/8, differentia i&longs;ta 0,4475 augeretur in duplicata illa ra­
tione, adeoque evaderet 1,5295. Hæc ita &longs;e haberent, ex hy­
pothe&longs;i quod re&longs;i&longs;tentia Penduli e&longs;&longs;et in duplicata ratione velo­
citatis.

Ergo &longs;i pendulum de&longs;criberet arcum totum (124 1/31) di­
gitorum, & longitudo ejus inter punctum &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis & cen­
trum o&longs;cillationis e&longs;&longs;et 126 digitorum, differentia arcuum de­
&longs;cen&longs;u & &longs;ub&longs;equente a&longs;cen&longs;u de&longs;criptorum foret 1,5295 digito­
rum.

Et hæc differentia ducta in pondus Globi penduli, quod erat
unciarum 208, producit 318,136. Rur&longs;us ubi pendulum &longs;uperius
ex Globo ligneo con&longs;tructum, centro o&longs;cillationis, quod a puncto
&longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis digitos 126 di&longs;tabat, de&longs;cribebat arcum totum (124 1/31)
digitorum, differentia arcuum de&longs;cen&longs;u & a&longs;cen&longs;u de&longs;criptum fuit
(126/121) in (8/9 2/3), quæ ducta in pondus Globi, quod erat unciarum (57 1/22),
producit 49,396. Duxi autem differentias ha&longs;ce in pondera Glo­
borum ut invenirem eorum re&longs;i&longs;tentias.

Nam differentiæ ori-
untur ex re&longs;i&longs;tentiis, &longs;untque ut re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ directe & pondera in­
ver&longs;e.

Sunt igitur re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ ut numeri 318,136 & 49,396. Pars
autem re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ Globi minoris, quæ e&longs;t in duplicata ratione velo­
citatis, erat ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam totam, ut 0,56752 ad 0,61675, id e&longs;t, ut
45,453 ad 49,396; & pars re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ Globi majoris propemodum
æquatur ip&longs;ius re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ toti; adeoque partes illæ &longs;unt ut 318,136
& 45,453 quamproxime, id e&longs;t, ut 7 & 1. Sunt autem Globorum
diametri 18 1/4 & 6 7/8; & harum quadrata (351 9/16) & (47 17/64) &longs;unt ut 7,438
& 1, id e&longs;t, ut Globorum re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ 7 & 1 quamproxime.

Diffe­
rentia rationum haud major e&longs;t quam quæ ex fili re&longs;i&longs;tentia oriri po­
tuit.

Igitur re&longs;i&longs;tentiarum partes illæ quæ &longs;unt, paribus Globis, ut
quadrata velocitatum; &longs;unt etiam, paribus velocitatibus, ut qua­
drata diametrorum Globorum.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Cæterum Globorum, quibus u&longs;us &longs;um in his experimentis, max­
imus non erat perfecte Sphæricus, & propterea in calculo hic allato
minutias qua&longs;dam brevitatis gratia neglexi; de calculo accurato in
experimento non &longs;atis accurato minime &longs;ollicitus.

Optarim itaque
(cum demon&longs;tratio Vacui ex his dependeat) ut experimenta cum
Globis & pluribus & majoribus & magis accuratis tentarentur.

Si
Globi &longs;umantur in proportione Geometrica, puta quorum diametri
&longs;int digitorum 4, 8, 16, 32; ex progre&longs;&longs;ione experimentorum col­
ligetur quid in Globis adhuc majoribus evenire debeat.

Jam vero conferendo re&longs;i&longs;tentias diver&longs;orum Fluidorum inter &longs;e
tentavi &longs;equentia.

Arcam ligneam paravi longitudine pedum qua­
tuor, latitudine & altitudine pedis unius.

Hanc operculo nuda­
tam implevi aqua fontana, fecique ut immer&longs;a pendula in medio
aquæ o&longs;cillando moverentur.

Globus autem plumbeus pondere
166 1/6 unciarum, diametro 3 5/8 digitorum, movebatur ut in Tabula
&longs;equente de&longs;crip&longs;imus, exi&longs;tente videlicet longitudine penduli a
puncto &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis ad punctum quoddam in filo notatum 126 di­
gitorum, ad o&longs;cillationis autem centrum 134 1/8 digitorum.

row.cell:
Arcus de&longs;cen&longs;u primo a puncto in
filo notato de&longs;criptus, digitorum

Arcuum differentia motui ami&longs;&longs;o
proportionalis, digitorum

p.s:
DE MOTU
CORPORUM

In experimento columnæ quartæ, motus æquales o&longs;cillationibus
535 in aere, & 1 1/5 in aqua ami&longs;&longs;i &longs;unt.

Erant quidem o&longs;cillationes
in aere paulo celeriores quam in aqua.

At &longs;i o&longs;cillationes in aqua
in ea ratione accelerarentur ut motus pendulorum in Medio utro­
que fierent æquiveloces, maneret numerus idem o&longs;cillationum 1 1/5
in aqua, quibus motus idem ac prius amitteretur; ob re&longs;i&longs;tentiam
auctam & &longs;imul quadratum temporis diminutum in eadem ratione
illa duplicata.

Paribus igitur pendulorum velocitatibus motus æ­
quales in aere o&longs;cillationibus 535 & in aqua o&longs;cillationibus 1 1/5 ami&longs;&longs;i
&longs;unt; ideoque re&longs;i&longs;tentia penduli in aqua e&longs;t ad ejus re&longs;i&longs;tentiam in
aere ut 535 ad 1 1/5. Hæc e&longs;t proportio re&longs;i&longs;tentiarum totarum in
ca&longs;u columnæ quartæ.

De&longs;ignet jam AV+CV differentiam arcuum in de&longs;cen&longs;u & &longs;ub­
&longs;equente a&longs;cen&longs;u de&longs;criptorum a Globo, in Aere cum velocitate maxi­
ma V moto; & cum velocitas maxima, in ca&longs;u columnæ quartæ, &longs;it
ad velocitatem maximam in ca&longs;u columnæ primæ, ut 1 ad 8; & diffe­
rentia illa arcuum, in ca&longs;u columnæ quartæ, ad differentiam in ca&longs;u
columnæ primæ ut (2/535) ad (16/85 1/2), &longs;eu ut 85 1/2 ad 4280: &longs;eribamus in
his ca&longs;ibus 1 & 8 pro velocitatibus, atque 85 1/2 & 4280 pro dif­
ferentiis arcuum, & fiet A+C=85 1/2 & 8A+64C=4280 &longs;eu
A+8C=535; indeque per reductionem æquationum proveniet
7C=449 1/2 & C=(64 1/14) & A=21 1/7: atque adeo re&longs;i&longs;tentia, cum
&longs;it ut (7/11) AV+1/4 CV2, erit ut (13 6/11)V+(48 1/56)V2. Quare in ca&longs;u co­
lumnæ quartæ, ubi velocitas erat 1, re&longs;i&longs;tentia tota e&longs;t ad partem
&longs;uam quadrato velocitatis proportionalem, ut (13 6/11)+(48 2/56) &longs;eu
(61 12/17) ad (48 9/56); & idcirco re&longs;i&longs;tentia penduli in aqua e&longs;t ad re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tiæ partem illam in aere quæ quadrato velocitatis proportionalis
e&longs;t, quæque &longs;ola in motibus velocioribus con&longs;ideranda venit, ut (61 12/17)
ad (48 9/56) & 535 ad 1 1/5 conjunctim, id e&longs;t, ut 571 ad 1. Si penduli
in aqua o&longs;cillantis filum totum fui&longs;&longs;et immer&longs;um, re&longs;i&longs;tentia ejus
fui&longs;&longs;et adhuc major; adeo ut penduli in aere o&longs;cillantis re&longs;i&longs;tentia
illa quæ velocitatis quadrato proportionalis e&longs;t, quæque &longs;ola in
corporibus velocioribus con&longs;ideranda venit, &longs;it ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam e­
ju&longs;dem penduli totius, eadem cum velocitate, in aqua o&longs;cillantis,
ut 800 vel 900 ad 1 circiter, hoc e&longs;t, ut den&longs;itas aquæ ad den&longs;ita­
tatem aeris quamproxime.

In hoc calculo &longs;umi quoQ.E.D.beret pars illa re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ penduli
in aqua, quæ e&longs;&longs;et ut quadratum velocitatis, &longs;ed (quod mirum for­
te videatur) re&longs;i&longs;tentia in aqua augebatur in ratione velocitatis
plu&longs;quam duplicata.

Ejus rei cau&longs;am inve&longs;tigando, in hanc in­
cidi, quod Arca nimis angu&longs;ta e&longs;&longs;et pro magnitudine Globi pen­
duli, & motum aquæ cedentis præ angu&longs;tia &longs;ua nimis impedie­
bat.

Nam &longs;i Globus pendulus, cujus diameter erat digiti u­
nius, immergeretur; re&longs;i&longs;tentia augebatur in duplicata ratione ve­
locitatis quam proxime.

Id tentabam con&longs;truendo pendulum ex
Globis duobus, quorum inferior & minor o&longs;cillaretur in aqua, &longs;u­
perior & major proxime &longs;upra aquam filo affixus e&longs;&longs;et, & in Aere
o&longs;cillando, adjuvaret motum penduli eumQ.E.D.uturniorem redde­
ret.

Experimenta autem hoc modo in&longs;tituta &longs;e habebant ut in Ta­
bula &longs;equente de&longs;cribitur.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Conferendo re&longs;i&longs;tentias Mediorum inter &longs;e, effeci etiam ut pen­
dula ferrea o&longs;cillarentur in argento vivo.

Longitudo fili ferrei erat
pedum qua&longs;i trium, & diameter Globi penduli qua&longs;i tertia pars di­
giti.

Ad filum autem proxime &longs;upra Mercurium affixus erat Glo­
bus alius plumbeus &longs;atis magnus ad motum penduli diutius conti­
nuandum.

Tum va&longs;culum, quod capiebat qua&longs;i libras tres argenti
vivi, implebam vicibus alternis argento vivo & aqua communi, ut
pendulo in Fluido utroque &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;ive o&longs;cillante, invenirem propor­
tionem re&longs;i&longs;tentiarum: & prodiit re&longs;i&longs;tentia argenti vivi ad re&longs;i­
&longs;tentiam aquæ, ut 13 vel 14 ad 1 circiter: id e&longs;t, ut den&longs;itas argen­
ti vivi ad den&longs;itatem aquæ. Ubi Globum pendulum paulo majo­
rem adhibebam, puta cujus diameter e&longs;&longs;et qua&longs;i 1/3 vel 2/3 partes di­
giti, prodibat re&longs;i&longs;tentia argenti vivi in ea ratione ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam
aquæ quam habet numerus 12 vel 10 ad 1 circiter.

Sed experi­
mento priori magis fidendum e&longs;t, propterea quod in his ultimis
Vas nimis angu&longs;tum fuit pro magnitudine Globi immer&longs;i.

Am­
pliato Globo, deberet etiam Vas ampliari.

Con&longs;titueram quidem
huju&longs;modi experimenta in va&longs;is majoribus & in liquoribus tum
Metallorum fu&longs;orum, tum aliis quibu&longs;dam tam calidis quam fri­
gidis repetere: &longs;ed omnia experiri non vacat, & ex jam de&longs;criptis
&longs;atis liquet re&longs;i&longs;tentiam corporum celeriter motorum den&longs;itati Flu­
idorum in quibus moventur proportionalem e&longs;&longs;e quam proxime.
Non dico accurate.

Nam Fluida tenaciora, pari den&longs;itate, procul-
dubio magis re&longs;i&longs;tunt quam liquidiora, ut Oleum frigidum quam
calidum, calidum quam aqua pluvialis, aqua quam Spiritus Vini.
Verum in liquoribus qui ad &longs;en&longs;um &longs;atis fluidi &longs;unt, ut in Aere, in
Aqua &longs;eu dulci &longs;eu &longs;al&longs;a, in Spiritibus Vini, Terebinthi & Salium,
in Oleo a fæcibus per de&longs;tillationem liberato & calefacto, Oleoque
Vitrioli & Mercurio, ac Metallis liquefactis, & &longs;iqui &longs;int alii, qui
tam fluidi &longs;unt ut in va&longs;is agitati motum impre&longs;&longs;um diutius con­
&longs;ervent, effu&longs;ique liberrime in guttas decurrendo re&longs;olvantur, nul­
lus dubito quin regula allata &longs;atis accurate obtineat: præ&longs;ertim &longs;i
experimenta in corporibus pendulis & majoribus & velocius motis
in&longs;tituantur.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Denique cum recepti&longs;&longs;ima Philo&longs;ophorum ætatis hujus opinio
&longs;it, Medium quoddam æthereum & longe &longs;ubtili&longs;&longs;imum extare,
quod omnes omnium corporum poros & meatus liberrime per­
meet; a tali autem Medio per corporum poros fluente re&longs;i&longs;tentia
oriri debeat: ut tentarem an re&longs;i&longs;tentia, quam in motis corporibus
experimur, tota &longs;it in eorum externa &longs;uperficie, an vero partes eti­
am internæ in &longs;uperficiebus propriis re&longs;i&longs;tentiam notabilem &longs;enti­
ant, excogitavi experimentum tale.

Filo pedum undecim longitu­
dinis, ab unco chalyoeo &longs;atis firmo, mediante annulo chalybeo, &longs;u­
&longs;pendebam pyxidem abiegnam rotundam, ad con&longs;tituendum pen­
dulum longitudinis prædictæ. Uncus &longs;ur&longs;um præacutus erat acie
concava, ut annulus arcu &longs;uo &longs;uperiore aciei innixus liberrime mo­
veretur.
Arcui autem inferiori annectebatur filum.

Pendulum ita
con&longs;titutum deducebam a perpendiculo ad di&longs;tantiam qua&longs;i pedum
&longs;ex, idque &longs;ecundum planum aciei unci perpendiculare, ne annu­
lus, o&longs;cillante pendulo, &longs;upra aciem unci ultro citroque laberetur.
Nam punctum &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis, in quo annulus uncum tangit, immo­
tum manere debet.

Locum igitur accurate notabam, ad quem de­
duxeram pendulum, dein pendulo demi&longs;&longs;o notabam alia tria loca ad
quæ redibat in fine o&longs;cillationis primæ, &longs;ecundæ ac tertiæ. Hoc re­
petebam &longs;æpius, ut loca illa quam potui accurati&longs;&longs;ime invenirem.
Tum pyxidem plumbo & gravioribus, quæ ad manus erant, me­
tallis implebam.

Sed prius ponderabam pyxidem vacuam, una
cum parte fili quæ circum pyxidem volvebatur ac dimidio par­
tis reliquæ inter uncum & pyxidem pendulam tendebatur.
(Nam filum ten&longs;um dimidio ponderis &longs;ui pendulum a perpendiculo
digre&longs;&longs;um &longs;emper urget.) Huic ponderi addebam pondus Aeris
quem pyxis capiebat.

Et pondus totum erat qua&longs;i pars &longs;eptuage­
&longs;ima octava pyxidis metallorum plenæ. Tum quoniam pyxis me-
tallorum plena, pondere &longs;uo tendendo filum, augebat longitudi­
nem penduli, contrahebam filum ut penduli jam o&longs;cillantis eadem
e&longs;&longs;et longitudo ac prius.

Dein pendulo ad locum primo notatum
retracto ac dimi&longs;&longs;o, numerabam o&longs;cillationes qua&longs;i &longs;eptuaginta &
&longs;eptem, donec pyxis ad locum &longs;ecundo notatum rediret, totidem­
que &longs;ubinde donec pyxis ad locum tertio notatum rediret, atque
rur&longs;us totidem donec pyxis reditu &longs;uo attingeret locum quartum.
Unde concludo quod re&longs;i&longs;tentia tota pyxidis plenæ non majorem
habebat proportionem ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam pyxidis vacuæ quam 78 ad
77. Nam &longs;i æquales e&longs;&longs;ent ambarum re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, pyxis plena ob
vim &longs;uam in&longs;itam &longs;eptuagies & octies majorem vi in&longs;ita pyxidis
vacuæ, motum &longs;uum o&longs;cillatorium tanto diutius con&longs;ervare debe­
ret, atque adeo completis &longs;emper o&longs;cillationibus 78 ad loca illa
notata redire.
Rediit autem ad eadem completis o&longs;cillationibus 77.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

De&longs;ignet igitur A re&longs;i&longs;tentiam pyxidis in ip&longs;ius &longs;uperficie exter­
na, & B re&longs;i&longs;tentiam pyxidis vacuæ in partibus internis; & &longs;i re&longs;i­
&longs;tentiæ corporum æquivelocium in partibus internis &longs;int ut mate­
ria, &longs;eu numerus particularum quibus re&longs;i&longs;titur: erit 78 B re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tia pyxidis plenæ in ip&longs;ius partibus internis: adeoque pyxidis va­
cuæ re&longs;i&longs;tentia tota A+B erit ad pyxidis plenæ re&longs;i&longs;tentiam to­
tam A+78 B ut 77 ad 78, & divi&longs;im A+B ad 77 B, ut 77 ad 1,
indeque A+B ad B ut 77X77 ad 1, & divi&longs;im A ad B ut 5928
ad 1. E&longs;t igitur re&longs;i&longs;tentia pyxidis vacuæ in partibus internis
quinquies millies minor quam eju&longs;dem re&longs;i&longs;tentia in externa &longs;uper­
ficie, & amplius.

Sic vero di&longs;putamus ex Hypothe&longs;i quod ma­
jor illa re&longs;i&longs;tentia pyxidis plenæ, non ab alia aliqua cau&longs;a latente
oriatur, &longs;ed ab actione &longs;ola Fluidi alicujus &longs;ubtilis in metallum
inclu&longs;um.
Hoc experimentum recitavi memoriter.

Nam charta, in qua il­
lud aliquando de&longs;crip&longs;eram, intercidit.

Unde fractas qua&longs;dam nu­
merorum partes, quæ memoria exciderunt, omittere compul&longs;us
&longs;um.
Nam omnia denuo tentare non vacat.

Prima vice, cum un­
co infirmo u&longs;us e&longs;&longs;em, pyxis plena citius retardabatur.

Cau&longs;am
quærendo, reperi quod uncus infirmus cedebat ponderi pyxidis, &
ejus o&longs;cillationibus ob&longs;eQ.E.D. in partes omnes flectebatur.

Para­
bam igitur uncum firmum, ut punctum &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis immotum ma­
neret, & tunc omnia ita evenerunt uti &longs;upra de&longs;crip&longs;imus.

SECTIO VII.
De Motu Fluidorum & Re&longs;i&longs;tentia Projectilium.
PROPOSITIO XXXII. THEOREMA XXVI.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Si Corporum Sy&longs;temata duo &longs;imilia ex æquali particularum numero
con&longs;tent, & particulæ corre&longs;pondentes &longs;imiles &longs;int & propor­
tionales, &longs;ingulæ in uno Sy&longs;temate &longs;ingulis in altero, & &longs;imiliter
&longs;itæ inter &longs;e, ac datam habeant rationem den&longs;itatis ad invicem,
& inter &longs;e temporibus proportionalibus &longs;imiliter moveri inci­
piant, (eæ inter &longs;e quæ in uno &longs;unt Sy&longs;temate & eæ inter &longs;e quæ
&longs;unt in altero) & &longs;i non tangant &longs;e mutuo quæ in eodem &longs;unt
Sy&longs;temate, ni&longs;i in momentis reflexionum, neque attrahant vel fu­
gent &longs;e mutuo, ni&longs;i viribus acceleratricibus quæ &longs;int ut particu­
larum corre&longs;pondentium diametri inver&longs;e & quadrata velocita.
tum directe: dico quod Sy&longs;tematum particulæ illæ pergent inter
&longs;e temporibus proportionalibus &longs;imiliter moveri.

Corpora &longs;imilia & &longs;imiliter &longs;ita temporibus proportionalibus in­
ter &longs;e &longs;imiliter moveri dico, quorum &longs;itus ad invicem in fine tem­
porum illorum &longs;emper &longs;unt &longs;imiles: puta &longs;i particulæ unius Sy&longs;te­
matis cum alterius particulis corre&longs;pondentibus conferantur.

Un­
de tempora erunt proportionalia, in quibus &longs;imiles & proportiona­
les Figurarum &longs;imilium partes a particulis corre&longs;pondentibus de­
&longs;cribuntur.

Igitur &longs;i duo &longs;int eju&longs;modi Sy&longs;temata, particulæ cor­
re&longs;pondentes, ob &longs;imilitudinem incæptorum motuum, pergent &longs;i­
militer moveri u&longs;Q.E.D.nec &longs;ibi mutuo occurrant.

Nam &longs;i nullis
agitantur viribus, progredientur uniformiter in lineis rectis per mo­
tus Leg. 1. Si viribus aliquibus &longs;e mutuo agitant, & vires illæ &longs;int
ut particularum corre&longs;pondentium diametri inver&longs;e & quadrata ve­
locitatum directe; quoniam particularum &longs;itus &longs;unt &longs;imiles & vires
proportionales, vires totæ quibus particulæ corre&longs;pondentes agi­
tantur, ex viribus &longs;ingulis agitantibus (per Legum Corollarium
fecundum) compo&longs;itæ, &longs;imiles habebunt determinationes, perin­
de ac &longs;i centra inter particulas &longs;imiliter &longs;ita re&longs;picerent; & erunt
vires illæ totæ ad invicem ut vires &longs;ingulæ componentes, hoc e&longs;t,
ut corre&longs;pondentium particularum diametri inver&longs;e, & quadrata
velocitatum directe: & propterea efficient ut corre&longs;pondentes par­
ticulæ figuras &longs;imiles de&longs;cribere pergant.

Hæc ita &longs;e habebunt per
Corol. 1, & 8 Prop. IV, Lib. 1. &longs;i modo centra illa quie&longs;cant.
Sin moveantur, quoniam ob tran&longs;lationum &longs;imilitudinem, &longs;imiles
manent eorum &longs;itus inter Sy&longs;tematum particulas; &longs;imiles indu­
centur mutationes in figuris quas particulæ de&longs;cribunt.

Similes igi­
tur erunt corre&longs;pondentium & &longs;imilium particularum motus u&longs;­
que ad occur&longs;us &longs;uos primos, & propterea &longs;imiles occur&longs;us, & &longs;i­
miles reflexiones, & &longs;ubinde (per jam o&longs;ten&longs;a) &longs;imiles motus in­
ter &longs;e donec iterum in &longs;e mutuo inciderint, & &longs;ic deinceps in in­
finitum. Q.E.D.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Corol.1. Hinc &longs;i corpora duo quævis, quæ &longs;imilia &longs;int & ad
Sy&longs;tematum particulas corre&longs;pondentes &longs;imiliter &longs;ita, inter ip&longs;as
temporibus proportionalibus &longs;imiliter moveri incipiant, &longs;intque
eorum magnitudines ac den&longs;itates ad invicem ut magnitudines ac
den&longs;itates corre&longs;pondentium particularum: hæc pergent tempori­
bus proportionalibus &longs;imiliter moveri.

E&longs;t enim eadem ratio par­
tium majorum Sy&longs;tematis utriu&longs;que atque particularum.

Corol.2. Et &longs;i &longs;imiles & &longs;imiliter po&longs;itæ Sy&longs;tematum partes om­
nes quie&longs;cant inter &longs;e: & earum duæ, quæ cæteris majores &longs;int, &
&longs;ibi mutuo in utroque Sy&longs;temate corre&longs;pondeant, &longs;ecundum lineas
&longs;imiliter &longs;itas &longs;imili cum motu utcunque moveri incipiant: hæ &longs;i­
miles in reliquis Sy&longs;tematum partibus excitabunt motus, & pergent
inter ip&longs;as temporibus proportionalibus &longs;imiliter moveri; atque
adeo &longs;patia diametris &longs;uis proportionalia de&longs;cribere.
PROPOSITIO XXXIII. THEOREMA XXVII.

Ii&longs;dem po&longs;itis, dico quod Sy&longs;tematum partes majores re&longs;i&longs;tituntur
in ratione compo&longs;ita ex duplicata ratione velocitatum &longs;uarum &
duplicata ratione diametrorum & ratione den&longs;itatis partium
Sy&longs;tematum.

Nam re&longs;i&longs;tentia oritur partim ex viribus centripetis vel centri­
fugis quibus particulæ Sy&longs;tematum &longs;e mutuo agitant, partim ex
occur&longs;ibus & reflexionibus particularum & partium majorum.
Prioris autem generis re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ &longs;unt ad invicem ut vires totæ mo­
trices a quibus oriuntur, id e&longs;t, ut vires totæ acceleratrices & quan­
titates materiæ in partibus corre&longs;pondentibus; hoc e&longs;t (per Hy­
pothe&longs;in) ut quadrata velocitatum directe & di&longs;tantiæ particula­
rum corre&longs;pondentium inver&longs;e & quantitates materiæ in partibus
corre&longs;pondentibus directe: ideoque (cum di&longs;tantiæ particularum Sy­
&longs;tematis unius &longs;int ad di&longs;tantias corre&longs;pondentes particularum alte­
rius, ut diameter particulæ vel partis in Sy&longs;temate priore ad dia­
metrum particulæ vel partis corre&longs;pondentis in altero, & quantita­
tes materiæ &longs;int ut den&longs;itates partium & cubi diametrorum) re&longs;i­
&longs;tentiæ &longs;unt ad invicem ut quadrata velocitatum & quadrata dia­
metrorum & den&longs;itates partium Sy&longs;tematum. Q.E.D.Po&longs;te­
rioris generis re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ &longs;unt ut reflexionum corre&longs;pondentium nu­
meri & vires conjunctim.

Numeri autem reflexionum &longs;unt ad in­
vicem ut velocitates partium corre&longs;pondentium directe, & &longs;patia
inter earum reflexiones inver&longs;e.

Et vires reflexionum &longs;unt ut ve­
locitates & magnitudines & den&longs;itates partium corre&longs;pondentium
conjunctim; id e&longs;t, ut velocitates & diametrorum cubi & den&longs;ita­
tes partium.

Et conjunctis his omnibus rationibus, re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ
partium corre&longs;pondentium &longs;unt ad invicem ut quadrata veloci­
tum & quadrata diametrorum & den&longs;itates partium conjunctim.
Q.E.D.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Corol.1. Igitur &longs;i Sy&longs;temata illa &longs;int Fluida duo Ela&longs;tica ad
modum Aeris, & partes eorum quie&longs;cant inter &longs;e: corpora autem
duo &longs;imilia & partibus fluidorum quoad magnitudinem & den&longs;ita­
tem proportionalia, & inter partes illas &longs;imiliter po&longs;ita, &longs;ecundum
lineas &longs;imiliter po&longs;itas utcunque projiciantur; vires autem acce­
leratrices, quibus particulæ Fluidorum &longs;e mutuo agitant, &longs;int ut
corporum projectorum diametri inver&longs;e, & quadrata velocitatum
directe: corpora illa temporibus proportionalibus &longs;imiles excita­
bunt motus in Fluidis, & &longs;patia &longs;imilia ac diametris &longs;uis propor­
tionalia de&longs;cribent.

Corol.2. Proinde in eodem Fluido projectile velox re&longs;i&longs;tentiam pa­
titur quæ e&longs;t in duplicata ratione velocitatis quam proxime.

Nam
&longs;i vires, quibus particulæ di&longs;tantes &longs;e mutuo agitant, augerentur in
duplicata ratione velocitatis, re&longs;i&longs;tentia foret in eadem ratione du­
plicata accurate; ideoQ.E.I. Medio, cujus partes ab invicem di&longs;tan­
tes &longs;e&longs;e viribus nullis agitant, re&longs;i&longs;tentia e&longs;t in duplicata ratione ve­
locitatis accurate.

Sunto igitur Media tria A, B, Cex partibus
&longs;imilibus & æqualibus & &longs;ecundum di&longs;tantias æquales regulariter
di&longs;po&longs;itis con&longs;tantia.

Partes Mediorum A& Bfugiant &longs;e mutuo
viribus quæ &longs;int ad invicem ut T& V,illæ Medii Ceju&longs;mo­
di viribus omnino de&longs;tituantur.

Et &longs;i corpora quatuor æqualia
D, E, F, Gin his Mediis moveantur, priora duo D& Ein pri­
oribus duobus A& B,& altera duo F& Gin tertio G; &longs;itque ve­
locitas corporis Dad velocitatem corporis E,& velocitas corpo­
ris Fad velocitatem corporis G,in &longs;ubduplicata ratione virium T
ad vires V: re&longs;i&longs;tentia corporis Derit ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam corporis E,
& re&longs;i&longs;tentia corporis Fad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam corporis G,in velocitatum
ratione duplicata; & propterea re&longs;i&longs;tentia corporis Derit ad re&longs;i­
&longs;tentiam corporis Fut re&longs;i&longs;tentia corporis Ead re&longs;i&longs;tentiam corpo­
ris G.Sunto corpora D& Fæquivelocia ut & corpora E& G;
& augendo velocitates corporum D& Fin ratione quacunque, ac
diminuendo vires particularum Medii Bin eadem ratione duplicata,
accedet Medium Bad formam & conditionem Medii Cpro lubi­
tu, & idcirco re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ corporum æqualium & æquivelocium E
& Gin his Mediis, perpetuo accedent ad æqualitatem, ita ut ea­
rum differentia evadat tandem minor quam data quævis.

Proinde
cum re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ corporum D& F&longs;int ad invicem ut re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ cor­
porum E& G,accedent etiam hæ &longs;imiliter ad rationem æqualita­
tis.

Corporum igitur D& F,ubi veloci&longs;&longs;ime moventur, re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tiæ &longs;unt æquales quam proxime: & propterea cum re&longs;i&longs;tentia cor­
poris F&longs;it in duplicata ratione velocitatis, erit re&longs;i&longs;tentia corporis
Din eadem ratione quam proxime.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Corol.3. Igitur corporis in Fluido quovis Ela&longs;tico veloci&longs;&longs;ime
moti eadem fere e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia ac &longs;i partes Fluidi viribus &longs;uis
centrifugis de&longs;tituerentur, &longs;eque mutuo non fugerent: &longs;i modo
Fluidi vis Ela&longs;tica ex particularum viribus centrifugis oriatur, &
velocitas adeo magna &longs;it ut vires non habeant &longs;atis temporis ad
agendum.

Corol.4. Proinde cum re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ &longs;imilium & æquivelocium cor­
porum, in Medio cujus partes di&longs;tantes &longs;e mutuo non fugiunt, &longs;int
ut quadrata diametrorum; &longs;unt etiam æquivelocium & celerrime
motorum corporum re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ in Fluido Ela&longs;tico ut quadrata
diametrorum quam proxime.

Corol.5. Et cum corpora &longs;imilia, æqualia & æquivelocia, in
Mediis eju&longs;dem den&longs;itatis, quorum particulæ &longs;e mutuo non fu­
giunt, &longs;ive particulæ illæ &longs;int plures & minores, &longs;ive pauciores &
majores, in æqualem materiæ quantitatem temporibus æqualibus
inpingant, eique æqualem motus quantitatem imprimant, & vi-
ci&longs;&longs;im (per motus Legem tertiam) æqualem ab eadem reactionem
patiantur, hoc e&longs;t, æqualiter re&longs;i&longs;tantur: manife&longs;tum e&longs;t etiam
quod in eju&longs;dem den&longs;itatis Fluidis Ela&longs;ticis, ubi veloci&longs;&longs;ime mo­
ventur, æquales &longs;int eorum re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ quam proxime; &longs;ive Fluida
illa ex particulis cra&longs;&longs;ioribus con&longs;tent, &longs;ive ex omnium &longs;ubtili&longs;&longs;i­
mis con&longs;tituantur.

Ex Medii &longs;ubtilitate re&longs;i&longs;tentia projectilium ce­
lerrime motorum non multum diminuitur.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM.

Corol.6. Hæc omnia ita &longs;e habent in Fluidis, quorum vis Ela­
&longs;tica ex particularum viribus centrifugis originem ducit.

Quod &longs;i
vis illa aliunde oriatur, veluti ex particularum expan&longs;ione ad in&longs;tar
Lanæ vel ramorum Arborum, aut ex alia quavis cau&longs;a, qua motus
particularum inter &longs;e redduntur minus liberi: re&longs;i&longs;tentia, ob mi­
norem Medii fluiditatem, erit major quam in &longs;uperioribus Co­
rollariis.
PROPOSITIO XXXIV. THEOREMA XXVIII.

Si Globus & Cylindrus æqualibus diametris de&longs;cripti, in Medio
raro ex particulis æqualibus & ad æquales ab invicem di&longs;tan­
tias libere di&longs;po&longs;itis con&longs;tante, &longs;ecundum plagam axis Cylindri,
æquali cum velocitate moveantur: erit re&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi duplo
minor quam re&longs;i&longs;tentia Cylindri.

Nam quoniam actio Medii in corpus eadem e&longs;t (per Legum
Corol, 5.) &longs;ive corpus in Medio quie&longs;cente moveatur, &longs;ive Medii
particulæ eadem cum velocitate impingant in corpus quie&longs;cens:
con&longs;ideremus corpus tanquam quie&longs;cens, & videamus quo impetu
urgebitur a Medio movente.

PROPOSITIO XXXV. PROBLEMA VII.

Si Medium rarum ex particulis quam minimis quie&longs;centibus æqua­
libus & ad æquales ab invicem di&longs;tantias libere di&longs;po&longs;itis con­
&longs;tet: invenire re&longs;i&longs;tentiam Globi in hoc Medio uniformitor pro­
gredientis.

Cas.1. Cylindrus eadem diametro & altitudine de&longs;criptus pro­
gredi intelligatur eadem velocitate &longs;ecundum longitudinem axis
&longs;ui in eodem Medio.

Et ponamus quod particulæ Medii in quas
Globus vel Cylindrus incidit, vi reflexionis quam maxima re&longs;iliant.
Et cum re&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi (per Propo&longs;itionem novi&longs;&longs;imam) &longs;it duplo
minor quam re&longs;i&longs;tentia Cylindri, & Globus &longs;it ad Cylindrum ut
duo ad tria, & Cylindrus incidendo perpendiculariter in particulas
ip&longs;a&longs;que quam maxime reflectendo, duplam &longs;ui ip&longs;ius velocitatem
ip&longs;is communicet: Cylindrus quo tempore dimidiam longitudinem
axis &longs;ui de&longs;cribit communicabit motum particulis qui &longs;it ad totum
Cylindri motum ut den&longs;itas Medii ad den&longs;itatem Cylindri; & Glo­
bus quo tempore totam longitudinem diametri &longs;uæ de&longs;cribit, com­
municabit motum eundem particulis; & quo tempore duas tertias
partes diametri &longs;uæ de&longs;cribit communicabit motum particulis qui
&longs;it ad totum Globi motum ut den&longs;itas Medii ad den&longs;itatem Globi.
Et propterea Globus re&longs;i&longs;tentiam patitur quæ &longs;it ad vim qua totus
ejus motus vel auferri po&longs;&longs;it vel generari quo tempore duas tertias
partes diametri &longs;uæ de&longs;cribit, ut den&longs;itas Medii ad den&longs;itatem
Globi.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Cas.2. Ponamus quod particulæ Medii in Globum vel Cylin­
drum incidentes non reflectantur; & Cylindrus incidendo perpen­
diculariter in particulas &longs;implicem &longs;uam velocitatem ip&longs;is commu­
nicabit, ideoque re&longs;i&longs;tentiam patitur duplo minorem quam in pri­
ore ca&longs;u, & re&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi erit etiam duplo minor quam prius.

Cas.3. Ponamus quod particulæ Medii vi reflexionis neque ma­
xima neque nulla, &longs;ed mediocri aliqua re&longs;iliant a Globo; & re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia Globi erit in eadem ratione mediocri inter re&longs;i&longs;tentiam in
primo ca&longs;u & re&longs;i&longs;tentiam in &longs;ecundo. Q.E.I.

Corol.1. Hinc &longs;i Globus & particulæ &longs;int infinite dura, & vi om­
ni ela&longs;tica & propterea etiam vi omni reflexionis de&longs;tituta: re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi erit ad vim qua totus ejus motus vel auferri po&longs;&longs;it
vel generari, quo tempore Globus quatuor tertias partes diametri
&longs;uæ de&longs;cribit, ut den&longs;itas Medii ad den&longs;itatem Globi.

Corol.2. Re&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi, cæteris paribus, e&longs;t in duplicata ra­
tione velocitatis.

Corol.3. Re&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi, cæteris paribus, e&longs;t in duplicata ra­
tione diametri.
Corol.4. Re&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi, cæteris paribus, e&longs;t ut den&longs;itas Medii.

Corol.5. Re&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi e&longs;t in ratione quæ componitur ex du­
plicata ratione velocitatis & duplicata ratione diametri & ratione
den&longs;itatis Medii.

Cas.1. Concipe jam cavitatem totam in va&longs;e, in circuitu aquæ

tis velocitatem generare debet.

rum aquæ effluentis, paulo majus e&longs;&longs;e debet quam prius.

Nam par­
ticulæ aquæ jam non tran&longs;eunt omnes per foramen perpendicula­

Parabam utique laminam
planam pertenuem in medio perforatam, exi&longs;tente circularis fora­

Et ne vena
aquæ exilientis cadendo acceleraretur & acceleratione redderetur

Dein
ubi vas aquæ plenum e&longs;&longs;et, aperui foramen ut aqua efflueret; &

marum digiti.

Erat igitur diameter foraminis hujus circularis ad
diametrum venæ ut 25 ad 21 quamproxime.

Per experimenta vero

vertitur.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Si longitudo Cylindri augeatur vel minuatur: motus ejus ut &
tempus quo quadruplum longitudinis &longs;uæ de&longs;cribit, augebitur vel
minuetur in eadem ratione; adeoque Vis illa qua motus auctus vel
diminutus, tempore pariter aucto vel diminuto, generari vel tolli
po&longs;&longs;it, non mutabitur; ac proinde etiamnum æqualis e&longs;t re&longs;i­
&longs;tentiæ Cylindri, nam & hæc quoQ.E.I.mutata manet per Lem­
ma IV.

Si den&longs;itas Cylindri augeatur vel minuatur: motus ejus ut &
Vis qua motus eodem tempore generari vel tolli pote&longs;t, in eadem
ratione augebitur vel minuetur.

Re&longs;i&longs;tentia itaque Cylindri cu­
ju&longs;cunque erit ad Vim qua totus ejus motus, interea dum quadru­
plum longitudinis &longs;uæ de&longs;cribit, vel generari po&longs;&longs;it vel tolli, ut
den&longs;itas Medii ad den&longs;itatem Cylindri quamproxime. Q.E.D.

Fluidum autem comprimi debet ut &longs;it continuum, continuum
vero e&longs;&longs;e & non ela&longs;ticum ut pre&longs;&longs;io omnis quæ ab ejus compre&longs;&longs;i­
one oritur propagetur in in&longs;tanti &, in omnes moti corporis partes
æqualiter agendo, re&longs;i&longs;tentiam non mutet.

Pre&longs;&longs;io utique quæ a
motu corporis oritur, impenditur in motum partium fluidi gene­
randum & Re&longs;i&longs;tentiam creat.

Pre&longs;&longs;io autem quæ oritur a com­
pre&longs;&longs;ione fluidi, utcunque fortis &longs;it, &longs;i propagetur in in&longs;tanti, nul­
lum generat motum in partibus fluidi continui, nullam omnino in­
ducit motus mutationem; ideoque re&longs;i&longs;tentiam nec auget nec mi­
nuit.

Certe Actio fluidi, quæ ab ejus compre&longs;&longs;ione oritur, fortior
e&longs;&longs;e non pote&longs;t in partes po&longs;ticas corporis moti quam in ejus par­
tes anticas, ideoque re&longs;i&longs;tentiam in hac Propo&longs;itione de&longs;criptam
minuere non pote&longs;t: & fortior non erit in partes anticas quam in
po&longs;ticas, &longs;i modo propagatio ejus infinite velocior &longs;it quam motus
corporis pre&longs;&longs;i.

Infinite autem velocior erit & propagabitur in in­
&longs;tanti, &longs;i modo fluidum &longs;it continuum & non ela&longs;ticum.

LEMMA V.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM.

Si Cylindrus, Sphæra & Sphærois, quorum latitudines &longs;unt æqua­

Ii&longs;dem po&longs;itis, corpora prædicta æqualiter urgentur ab aqua per

corpora in &longs;e mutuo æqualiter agunt.

SECUNDUS.

Si aqua quie&longs;cat in canali, & hæc corpora in partes contrarias
æquali velocitate per canalem ferantur: æquales erunt eorum
re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ inter &longs;e.

Con&longs;tat ex Lemmate &longs;uperiore, nam motus relativi iidem inter
&longs;e manent.
Scholium.

Eadem e&longs;t ratio corporum omnium convexorum & rotundo­
rum, quorum axes cum axe canalis coincidunt.

Differentia aliqua
ex majore vel minore frictione oriri pote&longs;t; &longs;ed in his Lemmatis
corpora e&longs;&longs;e politi&longs;&longs;ima &longs;upponimus, & Medii tenacitatem & frictio­
nem e&longs;&longs;e nullam, & quod partes fluidi, quæ motibus &longs;uis obliquis
& &longs;uperfluis fluxum aquæ per canalem perturbare, impedire, & re­
tardare po&longs;&longs;unt, quie&longs;cant inter &longs;e tanquam gelu con&longs;trictæ, & cor­
poribus ad ip&longs;orum partes anticas & po&longs;ticas adhæreant, perinde
ut in Scholio Propo&longs;itionis præcedentis expo&longs;ui.

Agitur enim in
&longs;equentibus de re&longs;i&longs;tentia omnium minima quam corpora rotunda,
datis maximis &longs;ectionibus tran&longs;ver&longs;is de&longs;cripta, habere po&longs;&longs;unt.

Corpora fluidis innatantia, ubi moventur in directum, efficiunt
ut fluidum ad partem anticam a&longs;cendat, ad po&longs;ticam &longs;ub&longs;idat, præ­
&longs;ertim &longs;i figura &longs;int obtu&longs;a; & inde re&longs;i&longs;tentiam paulo majorem
&longs;entiunt quam &longs;i capite & cauda &longs;int acutis.

Et corpora in fluidis
ela&longs;ticis mota, &longs;i ante & po&longs;t obtu&longs;a &longs;int, fluidum paulo magis
conden&longs;ant ad anticam partem & paulo magis relaxant ad po&longs;ticam;
& inde re&longs;i&longs;tentiam paulo majorem &longs;entiunt quam &longs;i capite & cau­
da &longs;int acutis.

Sed nos in his Lemmatis & Propo&longs;itionibus non
agimus de fluidis ela&longs;ticis, &longs;ed de non ela&longs;ticis; non de in&longs;identibus
fluido, &longs;ed de alte immer&longs;is.

Et ubi re&longs;i&longs;tentia corporum in fluidis
non ela&longs;ticis innote&longs;cit, augenda erit hæc re&longs;i&longs;tentia aliquantulum
tam in fluidis ela&longs;ticis, qualis e&longs;t Aer, quam in &longs;uperficiebus fluido­
rum &longs;tagnantium, qualia &longs;unt maria & paludes.
PROPOSITIO XXXVIII. THEOREMA XXX.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Globi, in Fluido compre&longs;&longs;o infinito & non ela&longs;tico uniformiter progre­
dientis, re&longs;i&longs;tentia e&longs;t ad vim qua totus ejus motus, quo tempore
octo tertias partes diametri &longs;uæ de&longs;cribit, vel tolli po&longs;&longs;it vel
generari, ut den&longs;itas Fluidi ad den&longs;itatem Globi quamproxime.

Nam Globus e&longs;t ad Cylindrum circum&longs;criptum ut duo ad tria;
& propterea Vis illa, quæ tollere po&longs;&longs;it motum omnem Cylindri
interea dum Cylindrus de&longs;cribat longitudinem quatuor diametro­
rum, Globi motum omnem tollet interea dum Globus de&longs;cribat
duas tertias partes hujus longitudinis, id e&longs;t, octo tertias partes
diametri propriæ. Re&longs;i&longs;tentia autem Cylindri e&longs;t ad hanc Vim
quamproxime ut den&longs;itas Fluidi ad den&longs;itatem Cylindri vel Globi,
per Prop.XXXVII; & Re&longs;i&longs;tentia Globi æqualis e&longs;t Re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ Cy­
lindri, per Lem. V, VI, VII. Q.E.D.

Corol.1. Globorum, in Mediis compre&longs;&longs;is infinitis, re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ &longs;unt
in ratione quæ componitur ex duplicata ratione velocitatis, & du­
plicata ratione diametri, & duplicata ratione den&longs;itatis Mediorum.

Corol.2 Velocitas maxima quacum Globus, vi ponderis &longs;ui com­
parativi, in fluido re&longs;i&longs;tente pote&longs;t de&longs;cendere, ea e&longs;t quam acqui­
rere pote&longs;t Globus idem, eodem pondere, ab&longs;que re&longs;i&longs;tentia caden­
do & ca&longs;u &longs;uo de&longs;cribendo &longs;patium quod &longs;it ad quatuor tertias
partes diametri &longs;uæ ut den&longs;itas Globi ad den&longs;itatem Fluidi.

Nam
Globus tempore ca&longs;us &longs;ui, cum velocitate cadendo acqui&longs;ita, de­
&longs;cribet &longs;patium quod erit ad octo tertias diametri &longs;uæ, ut den&longs;itas
Globi ad den&longs;itatem Fluidi; & vis ponderis motum hunc generans,
erit ad vim quæ motum eundem generare po&longs;&longs;it quo tempore Glo­
bus octo tertias diametri &longs;uæ eadem velocitate de&longs;cribit, ut den&longs;itas
Fluidi ad den&longs;itatem Globi: ideoque per hanc Propo&longs;itionem, vis
ponderis æqualis erit vi Re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, & propterea Globum accele­
rare non pote&longs;t.

Corol.3. Data & den&longs;itate Globi & velocitate ejus &longs;ub initio
motus, ut & den&longs;itate fluidi compre&longs;&longs;i quie&longs;centis in qua Globus
movetur; datur ad omne tempus & velocitas Globi & ejus re&longs;i­
ftentia & &longs;patium ab eo de&longs;criptum, per Corol. 7. Prop. XXXV.

Corol.4. Globus in fluido compre&longs;&longs;o quie&longs;cente eju&longs;dem &longs;ecum
den&longs;itatis movendo, dimidiam motus &longs;ui partem prius amittet
quam longitudinem duarum ip&longs;ius diametrorum de&longs;crip&longs;erit, per
idem Corol. 7.
PROPOSITIO XXXIX. THEOREMA XXXI.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Globi, per Fluidum in canali Cylindrico clau&longs;um & compre&longs;&longs;um uni­
formiter progredientis, re&longs;i&longs;tentia e&longs;t ad vim qua totus ejus motus,
interea dum octo tertias partes diametri &longs;uæ de&longs;cribit, vel ge­
nerari po&longs;&longs;it vel tolli, in ratione quæ componitur ex ratione ori­
ficii canalis ad exce&longs;&longs;um hujus orificii &longs;upra dimidium circuli
maximi Globi, & ratione duplicata orificii canalis ad exce&longs;&longs;um
hujus orificii &longs;upra circulum maximum Globi, & ratione den­
&longs;itatis Fluidi ad den&longs;itatem Globi quamproxime.

Patet per Corol. 2. Prop. XXXVII; procedit vero demon&longs;tratio
quemadmodum in Propo&longs;itione præcedente.
PROPOSITIO XL. PROBLEMA IX.

Globi, in Medio fluidi&longs;&longs;imo compre&longs;&longs;o progredientis, invenire re&longs;i­
&longs;tentiam per Phænomena.

Sit A pondus Globi in vacuo, B pondus ejus in Medio re&longs;i­
&longs;tente, D diameter Globi, F &longs;patium quod &longs;it ad 4/3 D ut den&longs;itas
Globi ad den&longs;itatem Medii, id e&longs;t, ut A ad A-B, G tempus quo
Globus pondere B ab&longs;que re&longs;i&longs;tentia cadendo de&longs;cribit &longs;patium F,
& H velocitas quam Globus hocce ca&longs;u &longs;uo acquirit.

Et erit H
velocitas maxima quacum Globus, pondere &longs;uo B, in Medio re&longs;i­
&longs;tente pote&longs;t de&longs;cendere, per Corol. 2, Prop. XXXVIII; & re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia quam Globus ea cum velocitate de&longs;cendens patitur, æqua­
lis erit ejus ponderi B: re&longs;i&longs;tentia vero quam patitur in alia qua­
cunque velocitate, erit ad pondus B in duplicata ratione velo­
citatis hujus ad velocitatem illam maximam H,&c. G, per Corol. 1,
Prop. XXXVIII.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM
Hæc e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia quæ oritur ab inertia materiæ Fluidi.

Ea
vero quæ oritur ab ela&longs;ticitate, tenacitate, & frictione partium
ejus, &longs;ic inve&longs;tigabitur.

Inveniatur numerus ab&longs;o­
lutus N qui congruit Logarithmo 0,4342944819(2P/G), &longs;itque L
Logarithmus numer; (N+1/N): & velocitas cadendo acqui&longs;ita erit
(N-1/N+1)H, altitudo autem de&longs;cripta erit (2PF/G)-1,3862943611 F+
4,605170186LF. Si Fluidum &longs;atis profundum &longs;it, negligi pote&longs;t
terminus 4,605170186LF; & erit (2PF/G)-1,3862943611 F altitude
de&longs;cripta quamproxime.

Patent hæc per Libri &longs;ecundi Propo­
&longs;itionem nonam & ejus Corollaria, ex Hypothe&longs;i quod Glo­
bus nullam aliam patiatur re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ni&longs;i quæ oritur ab inertia
materiæ. Si vero aliam in&longs;uper re&longs;i&longs;tentiam patiatur, de&longs;cen­
&longs;us erit tardior, & ex retardatione innote&longs;cet quantitas hujus re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiæ.

Ut corporis in Fluido cadentis velocitas & de&longs;cen&longs;us facilius in­
note&longs;cant, compo&longs;ui Tabulam &longs;equentem, cujus columna prima
denotat tempora de&longs;cen&longs;us, &longs;ecunda exhibet velocitates cadendo
acqui&longs;itas exi&longs;tente velocitate maxima 100000000, tertia exhibet
&longs;patia temporibus illis cadendo de&longs;cripta, exi&longs;tente 2 F &longs;patio quod
corpus tempore G cum velocitate maxima de&longs;cribit, & quarta ex­
hibet &longs;patia ii&longs;dem temporibus cum velocitate maxima de&longs;cripta.
Numeri in quarta columna &longs;unt (2P/G), & &longs;ubducendo numerum
1,3862944-4,6051702 L, inveniuntur numeri in tertia columna, &
multiplicandi &longs;unt hi numeri per &longs;patium F ut habeantur &longs;patia
cadendo de&longs;cripta.

Quinta his in&longs;uper adjecta e&longs;t columna, quæ
continet &longs;patia de&longs;cripta ii&longs;dem temporibus a corpore, vi ponderis
&longs;ui comparativi B, in vacuo cadente.

p.s: Scholium.

Ut re&longs;i&longs;tentias Fluidorum inve&longs;tigarem per Experimenta, paravi
vas ligneum quadratum, longitudine & latitudine interna digito­
rum novem pedis Londinen&longs;is,profunditate pedum novem cum
&longs;emi&longs;&longs;e, idemQ.E.I.plevi aqua pluviali; & globis ex cera & plum­
bo inclu&longs;o formatis, notavi tempora de&longs;cen&longs;us globorum, exi&longs;tente
de&longs;cen&longs;us altitudine 112 digitorum pedis.

Pes &longs;olidus cubicus
Londinen&longs;iscontinet 76 libras Romanasaquæ pluvialis, & pedis hu­
jus digitus &longs;olidus continet (19/36) uncias libræ hujus &longs;eu grana 253 1/3;
& globus aqueus diametro digiti unius de&longs;criptus continet grana
132,645 in Medio aeris, vel grana 132,8 in vacuo; & globus qui­
libet alius e&longs;t ut exce&longs;&longs;us ponderis ejus in vacuo &longs;upra pondus ejus
in aqua.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Exper.1. Globus, cujus pondus erat 156 1/4 granorum in aere &
77 granorum in aqua, altitudinem totam digitorum 112 tempore
minutorum quatuor &longs;ecundorum de&longs;crip&longs;it.

Et experimento repe­
tito, globus iterum cecidit eodem tempore minutorum quatuor &longs;e­
cundorum.

Pondus globi in vacuo e&longs;t (156 11/38) gran,& exce&longs;&longs;us hujus ponde­
ris &longs;upra pondus globi in aqua e&longs;t (79 11/38) gran.Unde prodit globi
diameter 0,84224 partium digiti.

E&longs;t autem ut exce&longs;&longs;us ille ad
pondus globi in vacuo, ita den&longs;itas aquæ ad den&longs;itatem globi,
& ita partes octo tertiæ diametri globi (viz.2,24597 dig.) ad &longs;pa­
tium 2 F, quod proinde erit 4,4256 dig.Globus tempore minuti
unius &longs;ecundi, toto &longs;uo pondere granorum (156 11/38), cadendo in va­
cuo de&longs;cribet digitos 193 1/3; & pondere granorum 77, eodem tem­
pore, ab&longs;que re&longs;i&longs;tentia cadendo in aqua de&longs;cribet digitos 95,219;
& tempore G, quod &longs;it ad minutum unum &longs;ecundum in &longs;ubduplicata
ratione &longs;patii F &longs;eu 2,2128 dig.ad 95,219 dig,de&longs;cribet 2,2128 dig.
& velocitatem maximam H acquiret quacum pote&longs;t in aqua de­
&longs;cendere.

E&longs;t igitur tempus G 0″,15244. Et hoc tempore G,
cum velocitate illa maxima H, globus de&longs;cribet &longs;patium 2 F digi­
torum 4,4256; ideoque tempore minutorum quatuor &longs;ecundo­
rum de&longs;cribet &longs;patium digitorum 116,1245. Subducatur &longs;patium
1,3862944 F &longs;eu 3,0676 dig.& manebit &longs;patium 113,0569 digito­
rum quod globus cadendo in aqua, in va&longs;e ampli&longs;&longs;imo, tempore
minutorum quatuor &longs;ecundorum de&longs;cribet.

Hoc &longs;patium, ob an­
gu&longs;tiam va&longs;is lignei prædicti, minui debet in ratione quæ compo­
nitur ex &longs;ubduplicata ratione orificii va&longs;is ad exce&longs;&longs;um orificii hu­
jus &longs;upra &longs;emicirculum maximum globi & ex &longs;implici ratione ori­
ficii eju&longs;dem ad exce&longs;&longs;um ejus &longs;upra circulum maximum globi, id
e&longs;t, in ratione 1 ad 0,9914. Quo facto, habebitur &longs;patium 112,08
digitorum, quod Globus cadendo in aqua in hoc va&longs;e ligneo tem­
pore minutorum quatuor &longs;ecundorum per Theoriam de&longs;cribere
debuit quamproxime.

De&longs;crip&longs;it vero digitos 112 per Experi­
mentum.

Exper.2. Tres Globi æquales, quorum pondera &longs;eor&longs;im erant
76 1/3 granorum in aere & (5 1/16) granorum in aqua, &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;ive demitte­
bantur; & unu&longs;qui&longs;que cecidit in aqua tempore minutorum &longs;ecun­
dorum quindecim, ca&longs;u &longs;uo de&longs;cribens altitudinem digitorum 112.

Computum ineundo prodcunt pondus globi in vacuo (76 1/12) gran,
exce&longs;&longs;us hujus ponderis &longs;upra pondus in aqua (71 17/48) gran,diameter
globi 0,81296 dig,octo tertiæ partes hujus diametri 2,16789 dig,
&longs;patium 2 F 2,3217 dig,&longs;patium quod globus pondere (5 1/16) gran,
tempore 1″, ab&longs;que re&longs;i&longs;tentia cadendo de&longs;cribat 12,808 dig,&
tempus G 0′,301056. Globus igitur, velocitate maxima quacum
pote&longs;t in aqua vi ponderis (5 1/16) gran.de&longs;cendere, tempore 0′,301056
de&longs;cribet &longs;patium 2,3217 dig.& tempore 15″ &longs;patium 115,678 dig.
Subducatur &longs;patium 1,3862944 F &longs;eu 1,609 dig.& manebit &longs;patium
114,069 dig.quod proinde globus eodem tempore in va&longs;e lati&longs;li­
mo cadendo de&longs;cribere debet.

Propter angu&longs;tiam va&longs;is no&longs;tri de­
trahi debet &longs;patium 0,895 dig.circiter.

Et &longs;ic manebit &longs;patium
113,174 dig.quod globus cadendo in hoc va&longs;e, tempore 15″ de­
&longs;cribere debuit per Theoriam quamproxime.

De&longs;crip&longs;it vero digi­
tos 112 per Experimentum.
Differentia e&longs;t in&longs;en&longs;ibilis.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Exper.3. Globi tres æquales, quorum pondera &longs;eor&longs;im erant
121 gran.in aere & 1 gran.in aqua, &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;ive demittebantur; &
cadebant in aqua temporibus 46″, 47″, & 50″, de&longs;cribentes alti­
tudinem digitorum 112.
Per Theoriam hi globi cadere debuerunt tempore 40″ circiter.

Quod tardius ceciderunt, vel bullulis nonnullis globo adhærenti­
bus, vel rarefactioni ceræ ad calorem vel tempe&longs;tatis vel manus
globum demittentis, vel erroribus in&longs;en&longs;ibilibus in ponderandis
globis in aqua, vel denique minori proportioni re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ quæ a
vi inertiæ in tardis motibus oritur ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam quæ oritur ab
aliis cau&longs;is, tribuendum e&longs;&longs;e puto.

Ideoque pondus globi in aqua
debet e&longs;&longs;e plurium granorum ut experimentum certum & fide dig­
num reddatur.

Exper.4. Experimenta hactenus de&longs;cripta cæpi ut inve&longs;tigarem
re&longs;i&longs;tentias fluidorum antequam Theoria, in Propo&longs;itionibus pro­
xime præcedentibus expo&longs;ita, mihi innote&longs;ceret.

Po&longs;tea, ut Theo­
riam inventam examinarem, paravi vas ligneum latitudine interna
digitorum 8 2/3, profunditate pedum quindecim cum triente.

De­
inde ex cera & plumbo inclu&longs;o globos quatuor formavi, &longs;ingulos
pondere 139 1/4 granorum in aere & 7 1/8 granorum in aqua.

Et hos
demi&longs;i ut tempora cadendi in aqua per pendulum, ad &longs;emi-minuta
&longs;ecunda o&longs;cillans, men&longs;urarem.

Globi, ubi ponderabantur & po­
&longs;tea cadebant, frigidi erant & aliquamdiu frigidi man&longs;erant; quia
calor ceram rarefacit, & per rarefactionem diminuit pondus globi
in aqua, & cera rarefacta non &longs;tatim ad den&longs;itatem pri&longs;tinam per
frigus reducitur.

Antequam caderent, immergebantur penitus in
aquam; ne pondere partis alicujus ex aqua extantis de&longs;cen&longs;us eo­
rum &longs;ub initio acceleraretur.

Et ubi penitus immer&longs;i quie&longs;cebant,
demittebantur quam cauti&longs;&longs;ime, ne impul&longs;um aliquem a manu de­
mittente acciperent.

Ceciderunt autem &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;ive temporibus
o&longs;cillationum 47 1/2, 48 1/2, 50 & 51, de&longs;cribentes altitudinem pedum
quindecim & digitorum duorum.

Sed tempe&longs;tas jam paulo frigi­
dior erat quam cum globi ponderabantur, ideoQ.E.I.eravi experi­
mentum alio die, & globi ceciderunt temporibus o&longs;cillationum
49, 49 1/2, 50 & 53, ac tertio temporibus o&longs;cillationum 49 1/2, 50, 51
& 53. Et experimento &longs;æpius capto, Globi ceciderunt maxima
ex parte temporibus o&longs;cillationum 49 1/2 & 50. Ubi tardius ce­
cidere, &longs;u&longs;picor eo&longs;dem retardatos fui&longs;&longs;e impingendo in latera
va&longs;is.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM.

Jam computum per Theoriam ineundo, prodeunt pondus globi
in vacuo 139 2/5 granorum.

G 0″,376843. Globus igitur, velocitate maxima quacum pote&longs;t in

ximum globi; & habebitur &longs;patium 181,86 digitorum, quod glo­
bus in hoc va&longs;e tempore o&longs;cillationum 50 de&longs;cribere debuit per
Theoriam quamproxime.

De&longs;crip&longs;it vero &longs;patium 182 digitorum
tempore o&longs;cillationum 49 1/2 vel 50 per Experimentum.

Exper.5. Globi quatuor pondere 154 1/8 gran.in aere & 21 1/2 gran.
in aqua, &longs;æpe demi&longs;&longs;i, cadebant tempore o&longs;cillationum 28 1/2, 29,
29 & 30, & nonnunquam 31, 32 & 33, de&longs;cribentes altitudinem
pedum quindecim & digitorum duorum.

Per Theoriam cadere debuerunt tempore o&longs;cillationum 29
quamproxime.

Exper.6. Globi quinque pondere 212 1/8 gran.in aere & 79 1/2 in
aqua, &longs;æpe demi&longs;&longs;i, cadebant tempore o&longs;cillationum 15, 15 1/2, 16,
17 & 18, de&longs;cribentes altitudinem pedum quindecim & digitorum
duorum.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Per Theoriam cadere debuerunt tempore o&longs;cillationum 15
quamproxime.

Exper.7. Globi quatuor pondere 293 1/8 gran.in aere & 35 1/8 gran.
in aqua, &longs;æpe demi&longs;&longs;i, cadebant tempore o&longs;cillationum 29 1/2, 30,
30 1/2, 31, 32 & 33, de&longs;cribentes altitudinem pedum quindecim &
digiti unius cum &longs;emi&longs;&longs;e.

Per Theoriam cadere debuerunt tempore o&longs;cillationum 28
quamproxime.

Cau&longs;am inve&longs;tigando cur globorum, eju&longs;dem ponderis & magNI­
tudinis, aliqui citius alii tardius caderent, in hanc incidi; quod glo­
bi, ubi primum demittebantur & cadere incipiebant, o&longs;cillarent cir­
cum centra, latere illo quod forte gravius e&longs;&longs;et, primum de&longs;cen­
dente, & motum o&longs;cillatorium generante.

Nam per o&longs;cillationes
&longs;uas, globus majorem motum communicat aquæ, quam &longs;i &longs;ine o&longs;cil­
lationibus de&longs;cenderet; & communicando, amittit partem motus
proprii quo de&longs;cendere deberet: & pro majore vel minore o&longs;cil­
latione, magis vel minus retardatur.

Quinetiam globus recedit
&longs;emper a latere &longs;uo quod per o&longs;cillationem de&longs;cendit, & receden­
do appropinquat lateribus va&longs;is & in latera nonnunquam impin­
gitur.

Et hæc o&longs;cillatio in globis gravioribus fortior e&longs;t, & in
majoribus aquam magis agitat.

Quapropter, ut o&longs;cillatio globo­
rum minor redderetur, globos novos ex cera & plumbo con&longs;truxi,
infigendo plumbum in latus aliquod globi prope &longs;uperficiem ejus;
& globum ita demi&longs;i, ut latus gravius, quoad fieri potuit, e&longs;&longs;et in­
fimum ab initio de&longs;cen&longs;us.

Sic o&longs;cillationes factæ &longs;unt multo mi­
nores quam prius, & globi temporibus minus inæqualibus cecide­
runt, ut in experimentis &longs;equentibus.

Exper.8. Globi quatuor pondere granorum 139 in aere & 6 1/2 in
aqua, &longs;æpe demi&longs;&longs;i, ceciderunt temporibus o&longs;cillationum non plu­
rium quam 52, non pauciorum quam 50, & maxima ex parte
tempore o&longs;cillationum 51 circiter, de&longs;cribentes altitudinem digi­
torum 182.

Per Theoriam cadere debuerunt tempore o&longs;cillationum 52
circiter.

Exper.9. Globi quatuor pondere granorum 273 1/4 in aere &
140 1/4 in aqua, &longs;æpius demi&longs;&longs;i, ceciderunt temporibus o&longs;cillationum
non pauciorum quam 12, non plurium quam 13, de&longs;cribentes al­
titudinem digitorum 182.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Per Theoriam vero hi globi cadere debuerunt tempore o&longs;cilla­
tionum 11 1/3 quamproxime.

Exper.10. Globi quatuor pondere granorum 384 in aere &
119 1/2 in aqua, &longs;æpe demi&longs;&longs;i, cadebant temporibus o&longs;cillationum
17 1/4, 18, 18 1/2 & 19, de&longs;cribentes altitudinem digitorum 181 1/2. Et
ubi ceciderunt tempore o&longs;cillationum 19, nonnunquam audivi im­
pul&longs;um eorum in latera va&longs;is antequam ad fundum pervenerunt.

Per Theoriam vero cadere debuerunt tempore o&longs;cillationum
15 3/9 quamproxime.

Exper.11. Globi tres æquales, pondere granorum 48 in aere
& (3 29/32) in aqua, &longs;æpe demi&longs;&longs;i, ceciderunt temporibus o&longs;cillationum
43 1/2, 44, 44 1/2, 45 & 46, & maxima ex parte 44 & 45, de&longs;cribentes
altitudinem digitorum 182 1/2 quamproxime.

Per Theoriam cadere debuerunt tempore o&longs;cillationum 46 5/9
circiter.

Exper.12. Globi tres æquales, pondere granorum 141 in aere
& 4 3/8 in aqua, aliquoties demi&longs;&longs;i, ceciderunt temporibus o&longs;cillatio­
num 61, 62, 63, 64 & 65, de&longs;cribentes altitudinem digitorum 182.

Et per Theoriam cadere debuerunt tempore o&longs;cillationum
64 1/2 quamproxime.

Per hæc Experimenta manife&longs;tum e&longs;t quod, ubi globi tarde ceci­
derunt, ut in experimentis &longs;ecundis, quartis, quintis, octavis, un­
decimis ac duodecimis, tempora cadendi recte exhibentur per
Theoriam: at ubi globi velocius ceciderunt, ut in experimentis
&longs;extis, nonis ac decimis, re&longs;i&longs;tentia paulo major extitit quam in
duplicata ratione velocitatis.

Nam globi inter cadendum o&longs;cillant
aliquantulum; & hæc o&longs;cillatio in globis levioribus & tardius ca­
dentibus, ob motus languorem cito ce&longs;&longs;at; in gravioribus autem &
majoribus, ob motus fortitudinem diutius durat, & non ni&longs;i po&longs;t
plures o&longs;cillationes ab aqua ambiente cohiberi pote&longs;t.

Quinetiam
globi, quo velociores &longs;unt, eo minus premuntur a fluido ad po­
&longs;ticas &longs;uas partes; & &longs;i velocitas perpetuo augeatur, &longs;patium va­
cuum tandem a tergo relinquent, ni&longs;i compre&longs;&longs;io fluidi &longs;imul au­
geatur.
Debet autem compre&longs;&longs;io fluidi (per Prop.

XXXII & XXXIII)
augeri in duplicata ratione velocitatis, ut re&longs;i&longs;tentia &longs;it in eadem
duplicata ratione.

Quoniam hoc non fit, globi velociores paulo
minus premuntur a tergo, & defectu pre&longs;&longs;ionis hujus, re&longs;i&longs;tentia
eorum fit paulo major quam in duplicata ratione velocitatis.

Congruit igitur Theoria cum phænomenis corporum caden­
tium in Aqua, reliquum e&longs;t ut examinemus phænomena caden­
tium in Aere.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Exper.13. A culmine Eccle&longs;iæ Sti Pauli,in urbe Londini,globi
duo vitrei &longs;imul demittebantur, unus argenti vivi plenus, alter
aeris; & cadendo de&longs;cribebant altitudinem pedum Londinen&longs;ium
220. Tabula lignea ad unum ejus terminum polis ferreis &longs;u&longs;pen­
debatur, ad alterum pe&longs;&longs;ulo ligneo incumbebat; & globi duo huic
Tabulæ impo&longs;iti &longs;imul demittebantur, &longs;ubtrahendo pe&longs;&longs;ulum, ut Ta­
bula polis ferreis &longs;olummodo innixa &longs;uper ii&longs;dem devolveretur, &
codem temporis momento pendulum ad minuta &longs;ecunda o&longs;cillans,
per filum ferreum a pe&longs;&longs;ulo ad imam Eccle&longs;iæ partem tendens,
dimitteretur & o&longs;cillare inciperet.

Diametri & pondera globorum
ac tempora cadendi exhibentur in Tabula &longs;equente.
Cæterum tempora ob&longs;ervata corrigi debent.

Nam globi mer­
curiales (per Theoriam Galilæi) minutis quatuor &longs;ecundis de&longs;cribent
pedes Londinen&longs;es257, & pedes 220 minutis tantum 3″ 42′.

Ta­
bula lignea utique, detracto pe&longs;&longs;ulo, tardius devolvebatur quam par
erat, & tarda &longs;ua devolutione impediebat de&longs;cen&longs;um globorum
&longs;ub initio.

Nam globi incumbebant Tabulæ prope medium ejus,
& paulo quidem propiores erant axi ejus quam pe&longs;&longs;ulo.

Et hinc
tempora cadendi prorogata fuerunt minutis tertiis octodecim cir­
citer, & jam corrigi debent detrahendo illa minuta, præ&longs;ertim in
globis majoribus qui Tabulæ devolventi paulo diutius incumbe­
bant propter magnitudinem diametrorum.

Quo facto, tempora
quibus globi &longs;ex majores cecidere, evadent, 8″, 12′, 7″ 42′, 7″ 42′,
7″ 57′, 8″ 12′, & 7″ 42′.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Globorum igitur aere plenorum quintus, diametro digitorum
quinque pondere granorum 483 con&longs;tructus, cecidit tempore
8″ 12′, de&longs;cribendo altitudinem pedum 220. Pondus aquæ huic
globo æqualis, e&longs;t 16600 granorum; & pondus aeris eidem æqualis
e&longs;t (16600/860) gran.&longs;eu (19 3/10) gran; ideoque pondus globi in vacuo e&longs;t
(502 3/10) gran; & hoc pondus e&longs;t ad pondus aeris globo æqualis, ut
(502 3/10) ad (19 3/10), & ita &longs;unt 2 F ad octo tertias partes diametri glo­
bi, id e&longs;t, ad (13 1/3) digitos.

Unde 2 F prodeunt 28 ped.11 dig.Glo­
bus cadendo in vacuo, toto &longs;uo pondere (502 3/10) granorum, tempore
minuti unius &longs;ecundi de&longs;cribit digitos 193 1/3 ut &longs;upra, & pondere
483 gran.de&longs;cribit digitos 185,905, & eodem pondere 483 gran.
etiam in vacuo de&longs;cribit &longs;patium F &longs;eu 14 ped.5 1/2 dig.tempore
57′ 58′, & velocitatem maximam acquirit quacum po&longs;&longs;it in aere
de&longs;cendere.

Hac velocitate globus, tempore 8″ 12′, de&longs;cribet &longs;pa­
tium pedum 245 & digitorum 5 1/3. Aufer 1,3863 F &longs;eu 20 ped.
0 1/2 dig.& manebunt 225 ped.5 dig.Hoc &longs;patium igitur globus,
tempore 8″ 12′, cadendo de&longs;cribere debuit per Theoriam.

De­
&longs;crip&longs;it vero &longs;patium 220 pedum per Experimentum.

Differentia
in&longs;en&longs;ibilis e&longs;t.

Similibus computis ad reliquos etiam globos aere plenos appli­
catis, confeci Tabulam &longs;equentem.

row.cell:
Tempora ca­
dendi ab al­
titudine pe­
dum220.

p.s:
Globorum igitur tam in Aere quam in Aqua motorum re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia prope omnis per Theoriam no&longs;tram recte exhibetur, ac
den&longs;itati fluidorum, paribus globorum velocitatibus ac magnitudi­
nibus, proportionalis e&longs;t.
In Scholio quod Sectioni &longs;extæ &longs;ubjunctum e&longs;t, o&longs;tendimus per

experimenta pendulorum quod globorum æqualium & æquivelo­
cium in Aere, Aqua, & Argento vivo motorum re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ &longs;unt ut
fluidorum den&longs;itates.

Idem hic o&longs;tendimus magis accurate per
experimenta corporum cadentium in Aere & Aqua.

Nam pendula
&longs;ingulis o&longs;cillationibus motum cient in fluido motui penduli re­
deuntis &longs;emper contrarium, & re&longs;i&longs;tentia ab hoc motu oriunda, ut
& re&longs;i&longs;tentia fili quo pendulum &longs;u&longs;pendebatur, totam Penduli re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiam majorem reddiderunt quam re&longs;i&longs;tentia quæ per experi­
menta corporum cadentium prodiit.

Etenim per experimenta
pendulorum in Scholio illo expo&longs;ita, globus eju&longs;dem den&longs;itatis
cum Aqua, de&longs;cribendo longitudinem &longs;emidiametri &longs;uæ in Aere,
amittere deberet motus &longs;ui partem (1/3342). At per Theoriam in hac
&longs;eptima Sectione expo&longs;itam & experimentis cadentium confirma­
tam, globus idem de&longs;cribendo longitudinem eandem, amittere de­
beret motus &longs;ui partem tantum (1/4586), po&longs;ito quod den&longs;itas Aquæ &longs;it
ad den&longs;itatem Aeris ut 860 ad 1. Re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ igitur per experi­
menta pendulorum majores prodiere (ob cau&longs;as jam de&longs;criptas)
quam per experimenta globorum cadentium, idQ.E.I. ratione 4 ad
3 circiter.

Attamen cum pendulorum in Aere, Aqua, & Argento
vivo o&longs;cillantium re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ a cau&longs;is &longs;imilibus &longs;imiliter augeantur,
proportio re&longs;i&longs;tentiarum in his Mediis, tam per experimenta pen­
dulorum, quam per experimenta corporum cadentium, &longs;atis recte
exhibebitur.

Et inde concludi pote&longs;t quod corporum in fluidis
quibu&longs;cunque fluidi&longs;&longs;imis motorum re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, cæteris paribus,
&longs;unt ut den&longs;itates fluidorum.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

His ita &longs;tabilitis, dicere jam licet quamnam motus &longs;ui partem
globus quilibet, in fluido quocunque projectus, dato tempore amit­
tet quamproxime.

Sit D diameter globi, & V velocitas ejus &longs;ub
initio motus, & T tempus quo globus velocitate V in vacuo de­
&longs;cribet &longs;patium quod &longs;it ad &longs;patium 2/3D ut den&longs;itas globi ad den&longs;i­
tatem fluidi: & globus in fluido illo projectus, tempore quovis
alio t,amittet velocitatis &longs;uæ partem (tV/T+t), manente parte (TV/T+t),
& de&longs;cribet &longs;patium quod &longs;it ad &longs;patium uniformi velocitate V eo­
dem tempore de&longs;criptum in vacuo, ut logarithmus numeri (T+t/T)
multiplicatus per numerum 2,302585093 e&longs;t ad numerum t/T, per
Corol.
7, Prop.XXXV.

In motibus tardis re&longs;i&longs;tentia pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e pau­
lo minor, propterea quod figura Globi paulo aptior &longs;it ad motum
quam figura Cylindri eadem diametro de&longs;cripti.

In motibus ve­
locibus re&longs;i&longs;tentia pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e paulo major, propterea quod ela&longs;ti­
citas & compre&longs;&longs;io fluidi non augeantur in duplicata ratione ve­
locitatis.
Sed huju&longs;modi minutias hic non expendo.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Et quamvis Aer, Aqua, Argentum vivum & &longs;imilia fluida, per
divi&longs;ionem partium in infinitum, &longs;ubtiliarentur & fierent Media in­
finite fluida; tamen globis projectis haud minus re&longs;i&longs;terent.

Nam
re&longs;i&longs;tentia, de qua agitur in Propo&longs;itionibus præcedentibus, oritur
ab inertia materiæ; & inertia materiæ corporibus e&longs;&longs;entialis e&longs;t &
quantitati materiæ &longs;emper proportionalis.

Per divi&longs;ionem partium
fluidi, re&longs;i&longs;tentia quæ oritur a tenacitate & frictione partium, di­
minui quidem pote&longs;t: &longs;ed quantitas materiæ per divi&longs;ionem par­
tium ejus non diminuitur; & manente quantitate materiæ, manet
ejus vis inertiæ cui re&longs;i&longs;tentia, de qua hic agitur, &longs;emper proportio­
nalis e&longs;t.

Ut hæc re&longs;i&longs;tentia diminuatur, diminui debet quantitas
materiæ in &longs;patiis per quæ corpora moventur.

Et propterea &longs;pa­
tia Cœle&longs;tia, per quæ globi Planetarum & Cometarum in omnes
partes liberrime & ab&longs;que omni motus diminutione &longs;en&longs;ibili per­
petuo moventur, fluido omni corporeo de&longs;tituuntur, &longs;i forte vapo­
res longe tenui&longs;&longs;imos & trajectos lucis radios excipias.

Projectilia utique motum cient in fluidis progrediendo, & hic
motus oritur ab exce&longs;&longs;u pre&longs;&longs;ionis fluidi ad projectilis partes anti­
cas &longs;upra pre&longs;&longs;ionem ad ejus partes po&longs;ticas, & non minor e&longs;&longs;e po­
te&longs;t in Mediis infinite fluidis quam in Aere, Aqua, & Argento vivo
pro den&longs;itate materiæ in &longs;ingulis.

Hic autem pre&longs;&longs;ionis exce&longs;&longs;us,
pro quantitate &longs;ua, non tantum motum ciet in fluido, &longs;ed etiam agit
in projectile ad motum ejus retardandum: & propterea re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia in omni fluido, e&longs;t ut motus in fluido a projectili excita­
tus, nec minor e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t in Æthere &longs;ubtili&longs;&longs;imo pro den&longs;itate
Ætheris, quam in Aere, Aqua, & Argento vivo pro den&longs;itatibus
horum fluidorum.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.
SECTIO VIII.
De Motu per Fluida propagato.
PROPOSITIO XLI. THEOREMA XXXII.

Pre&longs;&longs;io non propagatur per Fluidum &longs;ecundum lineas rectas, ni&longs;i
ubi particulæ Fluidi in directum jacent.

Si jaceant particulæ a, b, c, d, ein linea recta, pote&longs;t quidem
pre&longs;&longs;io directe propagari ab aad e; at
particula eurgebit particulas oblique po­
&longs;itas f& goblique, & particulæ illæ f& g
non &longs;u&longs;tinebunt pre&longs;&longs;ionem illatam, ni&longs;i
fulciantur a particulis ulterioribus h& k;
quatenus autem fulciuntur, premunt par­
ticulas fulcientes; & hæ non &longs;u&longs;tinebunt
pre&longs;&longs;ionem ni&longs;i fulciantur ab ulterioribus
l& mea&longs;que premant, & &longs;ic deinceps in infinitum.

Pre&longs;&longs;io igi­
tur, quam primum propagatur ad particulas quæ non in directum
jacent, divaricare incipiet & oblique propagabitur in infinitum;
& po&longs;tquam incipit oblique propagari, &longs;i inciderit in particulas
ulteriores, quæ non in directum jacent, iterum divaricabit; id­
que toties, quoties in particulas non accurate in directum ja­
centes inciderit. Q.E.D.

Corol.Si pre&longs;&longs;ionis, a dato puncto per Fluidum propagatæ, pars
aliqua ob&longs;taculo intercipiatur; pars reliqua, quæ non intercipitur,
divaricabit in &longs;patia pone ob&longs;taculum.

Id quod &longs;ic etiam de­
mon&longs;trari pote&longs;t.

A puncto Apropagetur pre&longs;&longs;io quaquaver­
&longs;um, idque &longs;i fieri pote&longs;t &longs;ecundum lineas rectas, & ob&longs;taculo
NBCKperforato in BC,intercipiatur ea omnis, præter par­
tem Coniformem APQ,quæ per foramen circulare BCtran&longs;it.

Planis tran&longs;ver&longs;is de, fg, hidi&longs;tinguatur conus APQin fru&longs;ta;
& interea dum conus ABC,pre&longs;&longs;ionem propagando, urget fru-
&longs;tum conicum ulterius degfin &longs;uperficie de,& hoc fru&longs;tum
urget fru&longs;tum proximum fgihin &longs;uperficie fg,& fru&longs;tum illud
urget fru&longs;tum tertium, & &longs;ic deinceps in infinitum; manife&longs;tum
e&longs;t (per motus Legem tertiam) quod fru&longs;tum primum defg,re­
actione fru&longs;ti &longs;ecundi fghi,tantum urgebitur & premetur in &longs;u­
perficie fg,quantum urget & premit fru&longs;tum illud &longs;ecundum.

Fru&longs;tum igitur degfinter conum Ade& fru&longs;tum fhigcom­
primitur utrinque, & propterea (per Corol.
6. Prop.

XIX.) figu­
ram &longs;uam &longs;ervare nequit, ni&longs;i vi eadem comprimatur undique.
Eodem igitur impetu quo premitur in &longs;uperficiebus de, fg,cona­
bitur cedere ad latera df, eg; ibique (cum rigidum non &longs;it, &longs;ed
omnimodo Fluidum) excurret ac dilatabitur, ni&longs;i Fluidum am­
biens ad&longs;it, quo conatus i&longs;te cohibeatur.

Proinde conatu excur­
rendi, premet tam Fluidum ambiens ad latera df, egquam fru&longs;tum
fghieodem impetu; & propterea pre&longs;&longs;io non minus propagabi­
tur a lateribus df, egin &longs;patia NO, KLhinc inde, quam pro­
pagatur a &longs;uperficie fgver&longs;us PQ. Q.E.D.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.
PROPOSITIO XLII. THEOREMA XXXIII.

Motus omnis per Fluidum propagatus divergit a recto tramite
in &longs;patia immota.

Cas.1. Propagetur motus a puncto Aper foramen BC,per­
gatque (&longs;i fieri pote&longs;t) in &longs;patio conico BCQP,&longs;ecundum li­
neas rectas divergentes a puncto C.Et ponamus primo quod
motus i&longs;te &longs;it undarum in &longs;uperficie &longs;tagnantis aquæ.

Sintque
de, fg, hi, kl,&c.

undarum &longs;ingularum partes alti&longs;&longs;imæ, valli­
bus totidem intermediis ab invicem di&longs;tinctæ.

Igitur quoniam
aqua in undarum jugis altior e&longs;t quam in Fluidi partibus immo­
tis LK, NO,defluet eadem de jugorum terminis e, g, i, l,&c.
d, f, h, k,&c.

hinc inde, ver&longs;us KL& NO: & quoniam in un­
darum vallibus depre&longs;&longs;ior e&longs;t quam in Fluidi partibus immotis
KL, NO; defluet eadem de partibus illis immotis in undarum
valles.

Defluxu priore undarum juga, po&longs;teriore valles hinc
inde dilatantur & propagantur ver&longs;us KL& NO.Et quo­
niam motus undarum ab Aver&longs;us PQfit per continuum de­
fluxum jugorum in valles proximos, adeoque celerior non e&longs;t
quam pro celeritate de&longs;cen&longs;us; & de&longs;cen&longs;us aquæ, hinc inde, ver­
&longs;us KL& NOeadem velocitate peragi debet; propagabitur
dilatatio undarum, hinc inde, ver&longs;us KL& NO,eadem velo­
citate qua undæ ip&longs;æ ab Aver&longs;us PQrecta progrediuntur.

Proindeque &longs;patium totum hinc inde, ver&longs;us KL& NO,ab
undis dilatatis rfgr, shis, tklt, vmnv,&c.

occupabitur.
que E. D.Hæc ita &longs;e habere quilibet in aqua &longs;tagnante expe­
riri pote&longs;t.

Cas.2. Ponamus jam quod de, fg, hi, kl, mnde&longs;ignent pul­
&longs;us a puncto A,per Medium Ela&longs;ticum, &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;ive propagatos.

Pul&longs;us propagari concipe per &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;ivas conden&longs;ationes & rare­
factiones Medii, &longs;ic ut pul&longs;us cuju&longs;que pars den&longs;i&longs;&longs;ima &longs;phæricam
occupet &longs;uperficiem circa centrum Ade&longs;criptam, & inter pul&longs;us
&longs;ucce&longs;&longs;ivos æqualia intercedant intervalla.

De&longs;ignent autem lineæ
