PROPOSITIO XLIII. THEOREMA XXXIV.

Corpus omne tremulum in Medio Ela&longs;tico propagabit motum pul­
&longs;uum undiQ.E.I. directum; in Medio vero non Ela&longs;tico motum
circularem excitabit.

Cas.1. Nam partes corporis tremuli vicibus alternis eundo &
redeundo, itu &longs;uo urgebunt & propellent partes Medii &longs;ibi proxi­
mas, & urgendo compriment ea&longs;dem & conden&longs;abunt; dein re­
ditu &longs;uo &longs;inent partes compre&longs;&longs;as recedere & &longs;e&longs;e expandere.

Igi­
tur partes Medii corpori tremulo proximæ ibunt & redibunt per
vices, ad in&longs;tar partium corporis illius tremuli: & qua ratione
partes corporis hujus agitabant ha&longs;ce Medii partes, hæ &longs;imilibus
tremoribus agitatæ agitabunt partes &longs;ibi proximas, eæque &longs;imiliter
agitatæ agitabunt ulteriores, & &longs;ic deinceps in infinitum.

Et
quemadmodum Medii partes primæ eundo conden&longs;antur & re­
deundo relaxantur, &longs;ic partes reliquæ quoties eunt conden&longs;abun­
tur, & quoties redeunt &longs;e&longs;e expandent.

Et propterea non omnes
ibunt & &longs;imul redibunt (&longs;ic enim determinatas ab invicem di&longs;tan­
tias &longs;ervando, non rarefierent & conden&longs;arentur per vices) &longs;ed ac­
cedendo ad invicem ubi conden&longs;antur, & recedendo ubi rarefiunt,
aliquæ earum ibunt dum aliæ redeunt; idque vicibus alternis in
infinitum.

Partes autem euntes & eundo conden&longs;atæ, ob motum
&longs;uum progre&longs;&longs;ivum quo feriunt ob&longs;tacula, &longs;unt pul&longs;us; & propte­
rea pul&longs;us &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;ivi a corpore omni tremulo in directum propaga­
buntur; idque æqualibus circiter ab invicem di&longs;tantiis, ob æqua­
lia temporis intervalla, quibus corpus tremoribus &longs;uis &longs;ingulis
&longs;ingulos pul&longs;us excitat.

Et quanquam corporis tremuli par­
tes eant & redeant &longs;ecundum plagam aliquam certam & determi­
natam, tamen pul&longs;us inde per Medium propagati &longs;e&longs;e dilatabunt
ad latera, per Propo&longs;itionem præcedentem; & a corpore illo tre­
mulo tanquam centro communi, &longs;ecundum &longs;uperficies propemo­
dum &longs;phæricas & concentricas, undique propagabuntur.

Cujus
rei exemplum aliquod habemus in Undis, quæ &longs;i digito tremulo
excitentur, non &longs;olum pergent hinc inde &longs;ecundum plagam motus
digiti, &longs;ed, in modum circulorum concentrieorum, digitum &longs;tatim
cingent & undique propagabuntur.

Nam gravitas Undarum &longs;up­
plet locum vis Ela&longs;ticæ.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Cas.2. Quod &longs;i Medium non &longs;it Ela&longs;ticum: quoniam ejus partes a
corporis tremuli partibus vibratis pre&longs;&longs;æ conden&longs;ari nequeunt, pro­
pagabitur motus in in&longs;tanti ad partes ubi Medium facillime ce­
dit, hoc e&longs;t, ad partes quas corpus tremulum alioqui vacuas a
tergo relinqueret.

Idem e&longs;t ca&longs;us cum ca&longs;u corporis in Medio
quocunque projecti.

Medium cedendo projectilibus, non rece­
dit in infinitum; &longs;ed in circulum eundo, pergit ad &longs;patia quæ
corpus relinquit a tergo.

Igitur quoties corpus tremulum per­
git in partem quamcunque, Medium cedendo perget per circu­
lum ad partes quas corpus relinquit; & quoties corpus regredi­
tur ad locum priorem, Medium inde repelletur & ad locum &longs;uum
priorem redibit.

Et quamvis corpus tremulum non &longs;it firmum,
&longs;ed modis omnibus flexile, &longs;i tamen magnitudine datum maneat,
quoniam tremoribus &longs;uis nequit Medium ubivis urgere, quin alibi
eidem &longs;imul cedat; efficiet ut Medium, recedendo a partibus
ubi premitur, pergat &longs;emper in orbem ad partes quæ eidem ce­
dunt Q.E.D.

Corol.Hallucinantur igitur qui credunt agitationem partium
Flammæ ad pre&longs;&longs;ionem, per Medium ambiens, &longs;ecundum lineas
rectas propagandam conducere.

Debebit eju&longs;modi pre&longs;&longs;io non
ab agitatione &longs;ola partium Flammæ, &longs;ed a totius dilatatione deri­
vari.

PROPOSITIO XLVIII. THEOREMA XXXVIII.

Pul&longs;uum in Fluido Ela&longs;tico propagatorum velocitates, &longs;unt in ra­
tione compo&longs;ita ex &longs;ubduplicata ratione vis Ela&longs;ticæ directe &
&longs;ubduplicata ratione den&longs;itatis inver&longs;e; &longs;i modo Fluidi vis
Ela&longs;tica eju&longs;dem conden&longs;ationi proportionalis e&longs;&longs;e &longs;upponatur.

Ca&longs;.1. Si Media &longs;int homogenea, & pul&longs;uum di&longs;tantiæ in his
Mediis æquentur inter &longs;e, &longs;ed motus in uno Medio inten&longs;ior &longs;it:
contractiones & dilatationes partium analogarum erunt ut iidem
motus.
Accurata quidem non e&longs;t hæc proportio.

Verum tamen
ni&longs;i contractiones & dilatationes &longs;int valde inten&longs;æ, non errabit
&longs;en&longs;ibiliter, ideoque pro Phy&longs;ice accurata haberi pote&longs;t.

Sunt
autem vires Ela&longs;ticæ motrices ut contractiones & dilatationes; &
velocitates partium æqualium &longs;imul genitæ &longs;unt ut vires.

Ideoque
æquales & corre&longs;pondentes pul&longs;uum corre&longs;pondentium partes,
itus & reditus &longs;uos per &longs;patia contractionibus & dilatationibus
proportionalia, cum velocitatibus quæ &longs;unt ut &longs;patia, &longs;imul pera­
gent: & propterea pul&longs;us, qui tempore itus & reditus unius lati­
tudinem &longs;uam progrediendo conficiunt, & in loca pul&longs;uum pro­
xime præcedentium &longs;emper &longs;uccedunt, ob æqualitatem di&longs;tantia­
rum, æquali cum velocitate in Medio utroque progredientur.

Ca&longs;.2. Sin pul&longs;uum di&longs;tantiæ &longs;eu longitudines &longs;int majores in
uno Medio quam in altero; ponamus quod partes corre&longs;ponden­
tes &longs;patia latitudinibus pul&longs;uum proportionalia &longs;ingulis vicibus
eundo & redeundo de&longs;cribant: & æquales erunt earum contra­
ctiones & dilatationes.

Ideoque &longs;i Media &longs;int homogenea, æqua­
les erunt etiam vires illæ Ela&longs;ticæ motrices quibus reciproco motu
agitantur.

Materia autem his viribus movenda, e&longs;t ut pul&longs;uum
latitudo; & in eadem ratione e&longs;t &longs;patium per quod &longs;ingulis vici­
bus eundo & redeundo moveri debent.

E&longs;tque tempus itus &
reditus unius in ratione compo&longs;ita ex ratione &longs;ubduplicata mate­
riæ & ratione &longs;ubduplicata &longs;patii, atque adeo ut &longs;patium.

Pul&longs;us
autem temporibus itus & reditus unius eundo latitudines &longs;uas

& propterea &longs;unt æquiveloces.

Ca&longs;3 In Mediis igitur den&longs;itate & vi Ela&longs;tica paribus, pul&longs;us
omnes &longs;unt æquiveloces.

Quod &longs;i Medii vel den&longs;itas vel vis Ela­
&longs;tica intendatur, quoniam vis motrix in ratione vis Ela&longs;ticæ, &
materia movenda in ratione den&longs;itatis augetur; tempus quo mo-
tus iidem peragantur ac prius, augebitur in &longs;ubduplicata ratione
den&longs;itatis, ac diminuetur in &longs;ubduplicata ratione vis Ela&longs;ticæ.

Et
propterea velocitas pul&longs;uum erit in ratione compo&longs;ita ex ratione

Nam tremores celeriores
& breviores difficilius excitantur.

&longs;imum e&longs;t.

Corol.3. Si cylindro & fluido ad hunc modum motis addatur
vel auferatur communis quilibet motus angularis; quoniam hoc
novo motu non mutatur attritus mutuus partium fluidi, non mu­
tabuntur motus partium inter &longs;e.

Nam tran&longs;lationes partium ab
invicem pendent ab attritu.

Pars quælibet in eo per&longs;everabit
motu, qui, attritu utrinQ.E.I. contrarias partes facto, non magis
acceleratur quam retardatur.

Corol.4. Unde &longs;i toti cylindrorum & fluidi Sy&longs;temati auferatur
motus omnis angularis cylindri exterioris, habebitur motus fluidi
in cylindro quie&longs;cente.

Corol.5. Igitur &longs;i fluido & cylindro exteriore quie&longs;centibus, re­
volvatur cylindrus interior uniformiter; communicabitur motus
circularis fluido, & paulatim per totum fluidum propagabitur;
nec prius de&longs;inet augeri quam fluidi partes &longs;ingulæ motum Corol­
lario quarto definitum acquirant.

Corol.6. Et quoniam fluidum conatur motum &longs;uum adhuc latius
propagare, hujus impetu circumagetur etiam cylindrus exterior
ni&longs;i violenter detentus; & accelerabitur ejus motus quoad u&longs;que
tempora periodica cylindri utriu&longs;que æquentur inter &longs;e.

Quod &longs;i
cylindrus exterior violenter detineatur, conabitur is motum fluidi

motum illum con&longs;ervet, efficiet ut idem paulatim ce&longs;&longs;et.

ter fluidum, numerus Orbium augeatur & latitudo minuatur in in­
finitum) ut areæ Hyperbolicæ his &longs;ummis analogæ AaQ, BbQ,
CcQ, DdQ, EeQ,&c.

Et tempora periodica motibus angu­
laribus reciproce proportionalia, erunt etiam his areis reciproce
proportionalia.

E&longs;t igitur tempus periodicum Orbis cuju&longs;vis
DIOreciproce ut area DdQ,hoc e&longs;t, (per notas Curvarum
quadraturas) directe ut quadratum di&longs;tantiæ SD.Id quod vo­
lui primo demon&longs;trare.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Cas.2. A centro Sphæræ ducantur infinitæ rectæ quam pluri­
mæ, quæ cum axe datos contineant angulos, æqualibus differen­
tiis &longs;e mutuo &longs;uperantes; & his rectis circa axem revolutis concipe
Orbes in annulos innumeros &longs;ecari; & annulus unu&longs;qui&longs;que habe­
bit annulos quatuor &longs;ibi contiguos, unum interiorem, alterum ex­
teriorem & duos laterales.

Attritu interioris & exterioris non
pote&longs;t annulus unu&longs;qui&longs;que, ni&longs;i in motu juxta legem ca&longs;us primi
facto, æqualiter & in partes contrarias urgeri.

Patet hoc ex de­
mon&longs;tratione ca&longs;us primi.

Et propterea annulorum &longs;eries quælibet
a Globo in infinitum recta pergens, movebitur pro lege ca&longs;us pri­
mi, ni&longs;i quatenus impeditur ab attritu annulorum ad latera.

Si an­
nuli, qui a centro æqualiter di&longs;tant, vel citius revolverentur vel
tardius juxta polos quam juxta æquatorem; tardiores accelera­
rentur, & velociores retardarentur ab attritu mutuo, & &longs;ic verge­
rent &longs;emper tempora periodica ad æqualitatem, pro lege ca&longs;us
primi.

Non impedit igitur hic attritus quo minus motus fiat &longs;e­
cundum legem ca&longs;us primi, & propterea lex illa obtinebit: hoc
e&longs;t, annulorum &longs;ingulorum tempora periodica erunt ut quadrata
di&longs;tantiarum ip&longs;orum à centro Globi.

Quod volui &longs;ecundo de­
mon&longs;trare.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Cas.3. Dividatur jam annulus unu&longs;qui&longs;que &longs;ectionibus tran&longs;­
ver&longs;is in particulas innumeras con&longs;tituentes &longs;ub&longs;tantiam ab&longs;olute
& uniformiter fluidam; & quoniam hæ &longs;ectiones non &longs;pectant ad
legem motus circularis, &longs;ed ad con&longs;titutionem Fluidi &longs;olummodo
conducunt, per&longs;everabit motus circularis ut prius.

His &longs;ectionibus
annuli omnes quam minimi a&longs;peritatem & vim attritus mutui aut
non mutabunt aut mutabunt æqualiter.

Et manente cau&longs;arum
proportione manebit effectuum proportio, hoc e&longs;t, proportio mo­
tuum & periodieorum temporum. Q.E.D.Cæterum cum motus
circularis, & abinde orta vis centrifuga, major &longs;it ad Eclipticam
quam ad Polos; debebit cau&longs;a aliqua ade&longs;&longs;e qua particulæ &longs;ingulæ
in circulis &longs;uis retineantur; ne materia quæ ad Eclipticam e&longs;t, rece­
dat &longs;emper à centro & per exteriora Vorticis migret ad Polos, in­
deque per axem ad Eclipticam circulatione perpetua revertatur.

Corol.1. Hinc motus angulares partium fluidi circa axem globi,
&longs;unt reciproce ut quadrata di&longs;tantiarum à centro globi, & veloci­
tates ab&longs;olutæ reciproce ut eadem quadrata applicata ad di&longs;tantias
ab axe.

Corol.2. Si globus in fluido quie&longs;cente &longs;imilari & infinito circa
axem po&longs;itione datum uniformi cum motu revolvatur, commuNI­
cabitur motus fluido in morem Vorticis, & motus i&longs;te paulatim
propagabitur in infin tum; neque prius ce&longs;&longs;abit in &longs;ingulis fluidi
partibus accelerari, quam tempora periodica &longs;ingularum partium
&longs;int ut quadrata di&longs;tantiarum à centro globi.

Corol.3. Quoniam Vorticis partes interiores ob majorem &longs;uam
velocitatem atterunt & urgent exteriores, motumQ.E.I.&longs;is ea acti-
one perpetuo communicant, & exteriores illi eandem motus quan­
titatem in alios adhuc exteriores &longs;imul tran&longs;ferunt, eaque actione
&longs;ervant quantitatem motus &longs;ui plane invariatam; patet quod mo­
tus perpetuo transfertur à centro ad circumferentiam Vorticis, &
per infinitatem circumferentiæ ab&longs;orbetur.

Materia inter &longs;phæri­
cas duas qua&longs;vis &longs;uperficies Vortici concentricas nunquam accele­
rabitur, eo quod motum omnem à materia interiore acceptum
transfert &longs;emper in exteriorem.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM

Corol.4. Proinde ad con&longs;ervationem Vorticis con&longs;tanter in eo­
dem movendi &longs;tatu, requiritur principium aliquod activum, à quo
globus eandem &longs;emper quantitatem motus accipiat, quam imprimit
in materiam Vorticis.

Ab&longs;que tali principio nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t ut globus
& Vorticis partes interiores, propagantes &longs;emper motum &longs;uum in
exteriores, neque novum aliquem motum recipientes, tarde&longs;cant
paulatim & in orbem agi definant.

Corol.5. Si globus alter huic Vortici ad certam ab ip&longs;ius centro
di&longs;tantiam innataret, & interea circa axem inclinatione datum vi
aliqua con&longs;tanter revolveretur; hujus motu raperetur fluidum in
Vorticem: & primo revolveretur hic Vortex novus & exiguus una
cum globo circa centrum alterius, & interea latius &longs;erperet ip&longs;ius
motus, & paulatim propagaretur in infinitum, ad modum Vorticis
primi.

Et eadem ratione qua hujus globus raperetur motu Vorti­
cis alterius, raperetur etiam globus alterius motu hujus, &longs;ic ut
globi duo circa intermedium aliquod punctum revolverentur, &longs;e­
que mutuo ob motum illum circularem fugerent, ni&longs;i per vim
aliquam cohibiti.

Po&longs;tea &longs;i vires con&longs;tanter impre&longs;&longs;æ, quibus
globi in motibus &longs;uis per&longs;everant, ce&longs;&longs;arent, & omnia legibus Me­
chanicis permitterentur, langue&longs;ceret paulatim motus globorum
(ob rationem in Corol.

3. & 4. a&longs;&longs;ignatam) & Vortices tandem
conquie&longs;cerent.

Corol.6. Si globi plures datis in locis circum axes po&longs;itione da­
tos certis cum velocitatibus con&longs;tanter revolverentur, fierent Vor­
tices totidem in infinitum pergentes.

Nam globi &longs;inguli, eadem
ratione qua unus aliquis motum &longs;uum propagat in infinitum, pro­
pagabunt etiam motus &longs;uos in infinitum, adeo ut fluidi infiniti
pars unaquæque eo agitetur motu qui ex omnium globorum acti­
onibus re&longs;ultat.

Unde Vortices non definientur certis limitibus,
&longs;ed in &longs;e mutuo paulatim excurrent; globique per actiones Vorti­
cum in &longs;e mutuo, perpetuo movebuntur de locis &longs;uis, uti in
Corollario &longs;uperiore expo&longs;itum e&longs;t; neque certam quamvis inter &longs;e
po&longs;itionem &longs;ervabunt, ni&longs;i per vim aliquam retenti.

Ce&longs;&longs;antibus
autem viribus illis quæ in globos con&longs;tanter impre&longs;&longs;æ con&longs;ervant
ho&longs;ce motus, materia ob rationem in Corollario tertio & quarto
a&longs;&longs;ignatam, paulatim requie&longs;cet & in Vortices agi de&longs;inet.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.

Corol.7. Si fluidum &longs;imilare claudatur in va&longs;e &longs;phærico, ac
globi in centro con&longs;i&longs;tentis uniformi rotatione agatur in Vorticem,
globus autem & vas in eandem partem circa axem eundem revol­
vantur, &longs;intque eorum tempora periodica ut quadrata &longs;emidiame­
trorum: partes fluidi non prius per&longs;everabunt in motibus &longs;uis &longs;ine
acceleratione & retardatione, quam &longs;int eorum tempora periodica
ut quadrata di&longs;tantiarum à centro Vorticis.

Alia nulla Vorticis
con&longs;titutio pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e permanens.

Corol.8. Si vas, fluidum inclu&longs;um & globus &longs;ervent hunc mo­
tum, & motu præterea communi angulari circa axem quemvis da­
tum revolvantur; quoniam hoc motu novo non mutatur attritus
partium fluidi in &longs;e invicem, non mutabuntur motus partium in­
ter &longs;e.
Nam tran&longs;lationes partium inter &longs;e pendent ab attritu.

Pars quælibet in eo per&longs;everabit motu, quo fit ut attritu ex uno
latere non magis tardetur quam acceleretur attritu ex altero.

Corol.9. Unde &longs;i vas quie&longs;cat ac detur motus globi, dabitur
motus fluidi.

Nam concipe planum tran&longs;ire per axem globi &
motu contrario revolvi; & pone &longs;ummam temporis revolutionis
hujus & revolutionis globi e&longs;&longs;e ad tempus revolutionis globi, ut
quadratum &longs;emidiametri va&longs;is ad quadratum &longs;emidiametri globi:
& tempora periodica partium fluidi re&longs;pectu plani hujus, erunt ut
quadrata di&longs;tantiarum &longs;uarum à centro globi.

Corol.10. Proinde &longs;i vas vel circa axem eundem cum globo, vel
circa diver&longs;um aliquem, data cum velocitate quacunque movea­
tur, dabitur motus fluidi.

Nam &longs;i Sy&longs;temati toti auferatur v &longs;is
motus angularis, manebunt motus omnes iidem inter &longs;e qui prius,
per Corol.
8. Et motus i&longs;ti per Corol.
9. dabuntur.

Corol.11. Si vas & fluidum quie&longs;cant & globus uniformi cum
motu revolvatur, propagabitur motus paulatim per fluidum torum
in vas, & circumagetur vas ni&longs;i violenter detentum, neque prius
definent fluidum & vas accelerari, quam &longs;int eorum tempora peri­
odica æqualia temporibus periodicis globi.

Quod &longs;i vas vi aliqua
detineatur vel revolvatur motu quovis con&longs;tanti & uniformi, de­
vemet Medium paulatim ad &longs;tatum motus in Corollariis 8. 9 & 10.
definiti, nes in alio unquam &longs;tatu quocunque per&longs;everabit.

De­
inde vero &longs;i, viribus illis ce&longs;&longs;antibus quibus vas & globus certis
motibus revolvebantur, permittatur Sy&longs;tema totum Legibus Me­
chanicis; vas & globus in &longs;e invicem agent mediante fluido, ne­
que motus &longs;uos in &longs;e mutuo per fluidum propagare prius ce&longs;&longs;a­
bunt, quam eorum tempora periodica æquentur inter &longs;e, & Sy&longs;te­
ma totum ad in&longs;tar corporis unius &longs;olidi &longs;imul revolvatur.

DE MOTU
CORPORUM
Scholium.

In his omnibus &longs;uppono fluidum ex materia quoad den&longs;itatem
& fluiditatem uniformi con&longs;tare.

Tale e&longs;t in quo globus idem
codem cum motu, in eodem temporis intervallo, motus &longs;imiles &
æquales, ad æquales &longs;emper à &longs;e di&longs;tantias, ubivis in fluido con&longs;ti­
tutus, propagare po&longs;&longs;it.

Conatur quidem materia per motum
&longs;uum circularem recedere ab axe Vorticis, & propterea premit
materiam omnem ulteriorem.

Ex hac pre&longs;&longs;ione fit attritus par­
tium fortior & &longs;eparatio ab invicem difficilior; & per con&longs;equens
diminuitur materiæ fluiditas.

Rur&longs;us &longs;i partes fluidi &longs;unt alicubi
cra&longs;&longs;iores &longs;eu majores, fluiditas ibi minor erit, ob pauciores &longs;uper­
ficies in quibus partes &longs;eparentur ab invicem.

In huju&longs;modi ca&longs;i­
bus deficientem fluiditatem vel lubricitate partium vel lentore alia­
ve aliqua conditione re&longs;titui &longs;uppono.

Hoc ni&longs;i fiat, materia ubi
minus fluida e&longs;t magis cohærebit & &longs;egnior erit, adeoque motum
tardius recipiet & longius propagabit quam pro ratione &longs;uperius
a&longs;&longs;ignata.

Si figura va&longs;is non &longs;it Sphærica, movebuntur particulæ
in lineis non circularibus &longs;ed conformibus eidem va&longs;is figuræ, &
tempora periodica erunt ut quadrata mediocrium di&longs;tantiarum à
centro quamproxime.

In partibus inter centrum & circumferen­
tiam, ubi latiora &longs;unt &longs;patia, tardiores erunt motus, ubi angu&longs;tiora
velociores, neque tamen particulæ velociores petent circumferen­
tiam.

Arcus enim de&longs;cribent minus curvos, & conatus recedendi
à centro non minus diminuetur per decrementum hujus curva­
turæ, quam augebitur per incrementum velocitatis.

Pergendo a
&longs;patiis angu&longs;tioribus in latiora recedent paulo longius a centro,
&longs;ed i&longs;to rece&longs;&longs;u tarde&longs;cent; & accedendo po&longs;tea de latioribus ad
angu&longs;tiora accelerabuntur, & &longs;ic per vices tarde&longs;cent & accelera­
buntur particulæ &longs;ingulæ in perpetuum.

Hæc ita &longs;e habebunt in
va&longs;e rigido.

Nam in fluido infinito con&longs;titutio Vorticum innote­
&longs;cit per Propo&longs;itionis hujus Corollarium &longs;extum.

Proprietates autem Vorticum hac Propo&longs;itione inve&longs;tigare co­
natus &longs;um, ut pertentarem &longs;iqua ratione Phænomena cœle&longs;tia per
Vortices explicari po&longs;&longs;int.

Nam Phænomenon e&longs;t, quod Planeta­
rum circa Jovem revolventium tempora periodica &longs;unt in ratione
&longs;e&longs;quiplicata di&longs;tantiarum a centro Jovis; & eadem Regula obti­
net in Planetis qui circa Solem revolvuntur.

Obtinent autem hæ
Regulæ in Planetis utri&longs;que quam accurati&longs;&longs;ime, quatenus ob&longs;er­
vationes A&longs;tronomicæ hactenus prodidere.

Ideoque &longs;i Planetæ
illi à Vorticibus circa Jovem & Solem revolventibus deferantur,
debebunt etiam hi Vortices eadem lege revolvi.

Verum tempora
periodica partium Vorticis prodierunt in ratione duplicata di&longs;tan­
tiarum a centro motus: neque pote&longs;t ratio illa diminui & ad ra­
tionem &longs;e&longs;quiplicatam reduci, ni&longs;i vel materia Vorticis eo fluidior
&longs;it quo longius di&longs;tat a centro, vel re&longs;i&longs;tentia, quæ oritur ex de­
fectu lubricitatis partium fluidi, ex aucta velocitate qua partes
fluidi &longs;eparantur ab invicem, augeatur in majori ratione quam ea
e&longs;t in qua velocitas augetur.

Quorum tamen neutrum rationi
con&longs;entaneum videtur.

Partes cra&longs;&longs;iores & minus fluidæ (ni&longs;i gra­
ves &longs;int in centrum) circumferentiam petent; & veri&longs;imile e&longs;t
quod, etiam&longs;i Demon&longs;trationum gratia Hypothe&longs;in talem initio
Sectionis hujus propo&longs;uerim ut Re&longs;i&longs;tentia velocitati proportiona­
lis e&longs;&longs;et, tamen Re&longs;i&longs;tentia in minori &longs;it ratione quam ea velocita­
tis e&longs;t.

Quo conce&longs;&longs;o, tempora periodica partium Vorticis erunt
in majori quam duplicata ratione di&longs;tantiarum ab ip&longs;ius centro.

Quod &longs;i Vortices (uti aliquorum e&longs;t opinio) celerius moveantur
prope centrum, dein tardius u&longs;que ad certum limitem, tum denuo
celerius juxta circumferentiam; certe nec ratio &longs;e&longs;quiplicata neque
alia quævis certa ac determinata obtinere pote&longs;t.

Viderint itaque
Philo&longs;ophi quo pacto Phænomenon illud rationis &longs;e&longs;quiplicatæ per
Vortices explicari po&longs;&longs;it.

LIBER
SECUNDUS.
PROPOSITIO LIII. THEOREMA XLI.

Corpora quæ in Vortice delata in orbem redeunt, eju&longs;dem &longs;unt den­
&longs;itatis cum Vortice, & eadem lege cum ip&longs;ius partibus (quoad
velocitatem & cur&longs;us determinationem) moventur.

Nam &longs;i Vorticis pars aliqua exigua, cujus particulæ &longs;eu puncta
phy&longs;ica datum &longs;ervant &longs;itum inter &longs;e, congelari &longs;upponatur: hæc,
quoniam neque quoad den&longs;itatem &longs;uam, neque quoad vim in&longs;itam
aut figuram &longs;uam mutatur, movebitur eadem lege ac prius: &
contra, &longs;i Vorticis pars congelata & &longs;olida eju&longs;dem &longs;it den&longs;itatis
cum reliquo Vortice, & re&longs;olvatur in fluidum; movebitur hæc ea­
dem lege ac prius, ni&longs;i quatenus ip&longs;ius particulæ jam fluidæ factæ
moveantur inter &longs;e.

Negligatur igitur motus particularum inter
&longs;e, tanquam ad totius motum progre&longs;&longs;ivum nil &longs;pectans, & motus
totius idem erit ac prius.

Motus autem idem erit cum motu alia­
rum Vorticis partium a centro æqualiter di&longs;tantium, propterea
quod &longs;olidum in Fluidum re&longs;olutum fit pars Vorticis cæteris parti­
bus con&longs;imilis.

Ergo &longs;olidum, &longs;i &longs;it eju&longs;dem den&longs;itatis cum ma­
teria Vorticis, eodem motu cum ip&longs;ius partibus movebitur, in ma­
teria proxime ambiente relative quie&longs;cens.

Sin den&longs;ius &longs;it, jam
magis conabitur recedere à centro Vorticis quam prius; adeoque
Vorticis vim illam, qua prius in Orbita &longs;ua tanquam in æquilibrio
con&longs;titutum retinebatur, jam &longs;uperans, recedet a centro & revol­
vendo de&longs;cribet Spiralem, non amplius in eundem Orbem rediens
Et eodem argumento &longs;i rarius &longs;it, accedet ad centrum.

Igitur non
redibit in eundem Orbem ni&longs;i &longs;it eju&longs;dem den&longs;itatis cum fluido
Eo autem in ca&longs;u o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t, quod revolveretur eadem lege cum
partibus fluidi à centro Vorticis æqualiter di&longs;tantibus. Q.E.D.

CORPORUM

Corol.1. Ergo &longs;olidum quod in Vortice revolvitur & in eundem
Orbem &longs;emper redit, relative quie&longs;cit in fluido cui innatat.

Corol.2. Et &longs;i Vortex &longs;it quoad den&longs;itatem uniformis, corpus
idem ad quamlibet a centro Vorticis di&longs;tantiam revolvi pote&longs;t.
Scholium.
Hinc liquet Planetas à Vorticibus corporeis non deferri.

Nam

tes Vorticis tali motu revolvi nequeunt.

Orbes tres circa Solem Sde&longs;criptos, quorum extimus CFcirculus
&longs;it Soli concentricus, & interiorum duorum Aphelia &longs;int A, B&
Perihelia D, E.Ergo corpus quod revolvitur in Orbe CF,radio
ad Solem ducto areas temporibus proportionales de&longs;cribendo, mo­

Corpus autem quod revolvitur in
Orbe BE,tardius movebitur in Aphelio B& velocius in Peri­
helio E,&longs;ecundum leges A&longs;tronomicas; cum tamen &longs;ecundum le­
ges Mechanicas materia Vorticis in &longs;patio angu&longs;tiore inter A& C
velocius moveri debeat quam in &longs;patio latiore inter D& F; id
e&longs;t, in Aphelio velocius quam in Perihelio.

Quæ duo repugnant
inter &longs;e.

Sic in principio Signi
Virginis, ubi Aphelium Martis
jam ver&longs;atur, di&longs;tantia inter or­
bes Martis & Veneris e&longs;t ad di­
&longs;tantiam eorundem orbium in
principio Signi Pi&longs;cium ut tria
ad duo circiter, & propterea
materia Vorticis inter Orbes il­
los in principio Pi&longs;cium debet
e&longs;&longs;e velocior quam in principio
Virginis in ratione trium ad duo.

Nam quo angu&longs;tius e&longs;t &longs;patium
per quod eadem Materiæ quan­
titas eodem revolutionis unius
tempore tran&longs;it, eo majori cum
velocitate tran&longs;ire debet.

Igitur &longs;i Terra in hac Materia cœ&longs;e­
&longs;ti relative quie&longs;cens ab ea deferretur, & una circa Solem re­
volveretur, foret hujus velocitas in principio Pi&longs;cium ad eju&longs;dem
velocitatem in principio Virginis in ratione &longs;e&longs;quialtera.

Unde
Solis motus diurnus apparens in principio Virginis major e&longs;&longs;et
quam minutorum primorum &longs;eptuaginta, & in principio Pi&longs;cium
minor quam minutorum quadraginta & octo: cum tamen (expe­
rientia te&longs;te) apparens i&longs;te Solis motus major &longs;it in principio Pi­
&longs;cium quam in principio Virginis, & propterea Terra velocior in
principio Virginis quam in principio Pi&longs;cium.

Itaque Hypothe&longs;is
Vorticum cum Phænomenis A&longs;tronomicis omnino pugnat, & non
tam ad explicandos quam ad perturbandos motus cœle&longs;tes, con­
ducit.

Quomodo vero motus i&longs;ti in &longs;patiis liberis ab&longs;que Vorti­
cibus peraguntur intelligi pote&longs;t ex Libro primo, & in Mundi
Sy&longs;temate plenius docebitur.

MUNDI
SYSTEMATE
LIBER TERTIUS.

IN Libris præcedentibus principia Philo&longs;ophiæ tradidi, non ta­
men Philo&longs;ophica &longs;ed Mathematica tantum, ex quibus vide­
licet in rebus Philo&longs;ophicis di&longs;putari po&longs;&longs;it.

Hæc &longs;unt mo­
tuum & virium leges & conditiones, quæ ad Philo&longs;ophiam ma­
xime &longs;pectant.

Eadem tamen, ne &longs;terilia videantur, illu&longs;travi
Scholiis quibu&longs;dam Philo&longs;ophicis, ea tractans quæ generalia &longs;unt,
& in quibus Philo&longs;ophia maxime fundari videtur, uti corporum
den&longs;itatem & re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, &longs;patia corporibus vacua, motumque
Lucis & Sonorum.

Supere&longs;t ut ex ii&longs;dem principiis doceamus con­
&longs;titutionem Sy&longs;tematis Mundani.

De hoc argumento compo&longs;ue­
ram Librum tertium methodo populari, ut a pluribus legeretur.

Sed quibus Principia po&longs;ita &longs;atis intellecta non fuerint, ii vim con­
&longs;equentiarum minime percipient, neque præjudicia deponent qui­
bus a multis retro annis in&longs;ueverunt: & propterea ne res in di&longs;pu­
tationes trahatur, &longs;ummam libri illius tran&longs;tuli in Propo&longs;itiones,
more Mathematico, ut ab iis &longs;olis legantur qui Principia prius
evolverint.

Veruntamen quoniam Propo&longs;itiones ibi quam pluri­
mæ occurrant, quæ Lectoribus etiam Mathematice doctis moram
nimiam injicere po&longs;&longs;int, author e&longs;&longs;e nolo ut qui&longs;quam eas omnes
evolvat; &longs;uffecerit &longs;iquis Definitiones, Leges motuum & &longs;ectiones
tres priores Libri primi &longs;edulo legat, dein tran&longs;eat ad hunc Li­
brum de Mundi Sy&longs;temate, & reliquas Librorum priorum Propo­
&longs;itiones hic citatas pro lubitu con&longs;ulat.

REGULÆ
PHILOSOPHANDI.
REGULA I.

Cau&longs;as rerum naturalium non plures admitti debere, quam quæ
& veræ &longs;int & earum Phænomenis explicandis &longs;ufficiant.

DIcunt utique Philo&longs;ophi: Natura nihil agit fru&longs;tra, & fru&longs;tra
fit per plura quod fieri pote&longs;t per pauciora.

Natura enim
&longs;implex e&longs;t & rerum cau&longs;is &longs;uperfluis non luxuriat.
REGULA II.

Ideoque Effectuum naturalium eju&longs;dem generis eædem &longs;unt
Cau&longs;æ.

Uti re&longs;pirationis in Homine & in Be&longs;tia; de&longs;cen&longs;us lapidum in
Europa& in America; Lucis in Igne culinari & in Sole; reflexi­
onis Lucis in Terra & in Planetis.
REGULA III.

Qualitates corporum quæ intendi & remitti nequeunt, quæque
corporibus omnibus competunt in quibus experimenta in&longs;tituere
licet, pro qualitatibus corporum univer&longs;orum habendæ &longs;unt.

Nam qualitates corporum non ni&longs;i per experimenta innote&longs;cunt;
ideoque generales &longs;tatuendæ &longs;unt quotquot cum experimentis ge­
neraliter quadrant; & quæ minui non po&longs;&longs;unt, non po&longs;&longs;unt au­
ferri.

Certe contra experimentorum tenorem &longs;omnia temere con­
fingenda non &longs;unt, nec a Naturæ ana logia recedendum e&longs;t, cum
ea &longs;implex e&longs;&longs;e &longs;oleat & &longs;ibi &longs;emper con&longs;ona.

Exten&longs;io corporum
non ni&longs;i per &longs;en&longs;us innote&longs;cit, nec in omnibus &longs;entitur: &longs;ed quia
&longs;en&longs;ibilibus omnibus competit, de univer&longs;is affirmatur, Corpora
plura dura e&longs;&longs;e experimur.

Oritur autem durities totius a duritie
partium, & inde non horum tantum corporum quæ &longs;entiuntur,
&longs;ed aliorum etiam omnium particulas indivi&longs;as e&longs;&longs;e duras merito
concludimus.

Corpora omnia impenetrabilia e&longs;&longs;e non ratione &longs;ed
&longs;en&longs;u colligimus.

Quæ tractamus, impenetrabilia inveniuntur, &
inde concludimus impenetrabilitatem e&longs;&longs;e proprietatem corporum
univer&longs;orum.

Corpora omnia mobilia o&longs;&longs;e, & viribus quibu&longs;dam
(quas vires inertiæ vocamus) per&longs;everare in motu vel quiete, ex
hi&longs;ce corporum vi&longs;orum proprietatibus colligimus.

Exten&longs;io, du­
rities, impenetrabilitas, mobilitas & vis inertiæ totius, oritur ab
exten&longs;ione, duritie, impenetrabilitate, mobilitate & viribus iner­
tiæ partium: & inde concludimus omnes omnium corporum par­
tes minimas extendi & duras e&longs;&longs;e & impenetrabiles & mobiles &
viribus inertiæ præditas.

Et hoc e&longs;t fundamentum Philo&longs;ophiæ
totius.

Porro corporum partes divi&longs;as & &longs;ibi mutuo contiguas ab
invicem &longs;eparari po&longs;&longs;e, ex Phænomenis novimus, & partes indi­
vi&longs;as in partes minores ratione di&longs;tingui po&longs;&longs;e ex Mathematica
certum e&longs;t.

Utrum vero partes illæ di&longs;tinctæ & nondum divi&longs;æ
per vires Naturæ dividi & ab invicem &longs;eparari po&longs;&longs;int, incertum
e&longs;t.

At &longs;i vel unico con&longs;taret experimento quod particula aliqua
indivi&longs;a, frangendo corpus durum & &longs;olidum, divi&longs;ionem patere­
tur: concluderemus vi hujus Regulæ, quod non &longs;olum partes di­
vi&longs;æ &longs;eparabiles e&longs;&longs;ent, &longs;ed etiam quod indivi&longs;æ in infinitum dividi
po&longs;&longs;ent.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE

Denique &longs;i corpora omnia in circuitu Terræ gravia e&longs;&longs;e in Ter­
ram, idque pro quantitate materiæ in &longs;ingulis, & Lunam gravem
e&longs;&longs;e in Terram pro quantitate materiæ &longs;uæ, & vici&longs;&longs;im mare no­
&longs;trum grave e&longs;&longs;e in Lunam, & Planetas omnes graves e&longs;&longs;e in &longs;e
mutuo, & Cometarum &longs;imilem e&longs;&longs;e gravitatem, per experimenta
& ob&longs;ervationes A&longs;tronomicas univer&longs;aliter con&longs;tet: dicendum erit
per hanc Regulam quod corpora omnia in &longs;e mutuo gravitant.

Nam & fortius erit argumentum ex Phænomenis de gravitate uNI­
ver&longs;ali, quam de corporum impenetrabilitate: de qua utiQ.E.I.
corporibus Cœle&longs;tibus nullum experimentum, nullam pror&longs;us ob­
&longs;ervationem habemus.
PHÆNOMENA.

LIBER
TERTIUS.
PHÆNOMENON I.

Planetas Circumjoviales, radiis ad centrum Jovis ductis, areas
de&longs;cribere temporibus proportionales, eorumque tempora periodica
e&longs;&longs;e in ratione &longs;e&longs;quiplicata di&longs;tantiarum ab ip&longs;ius centro.
COn&longs;tat ex ob&longs;ervationibus A&longs;tronomicis.

Orbes horum Pla­
netarum non differunt &longs;en&longs;ibiliter a circulis Jovi concentri­
cis, & motus eorum in his circulis uniformes deprehenduntur.

Tempora vero periodica e&longs;&longs;e in &longs;e&longs;quiplicata ratione &longs;emidiame­
trorum Orbium con&longs;entiunt A&longs;tronomi; & idem ex Tabula &longs;e­
quente manife&longs;tum e&longs;t.
Satellitum Jovialium tempora periodica.
PHÆNOMENON II.

Planetas Circum&longs;aturnios, radiis ad Saturnum ductis, areas de&longs;cri­
bere temporibus proportionales, & eorum tempora periodica
e&longs;&longs;e in ratione &longs;e&longs;quiplicata di&longs;tantiarum ab ip&longs;ius centro.

Ca&longs;&longs;inusutique ex ob&longs;ervationibus &longs;uis di&longs;tantias eorum a centro
Saturni & periodica tempora huju&longs;modi e&longs;&longs;e &longs;tatuit.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE

row.cell: Di&longs;tantiæ Satellitum a centro Saturni in &longs;emidiametris Annuli

p.s: PHÆNOMENON III.

Planetas quinque primarios Mercurium, Venerem, Martem, Jo­
vem & Saturnum Orbibus &longs;uis Solem cingere.

Mercurium & Venerem circa Solem revolvi ex eorum pha&longs;ibus
lunaribus demon&longs;tratur.

Plena facie lucentes ultra Solem &longs;iti &longs;unt,
dimidiata è regione Solis, falcata cis Solem; per di&longs;cum ejus ad
modum macularum nonnunquam tran&longs;euntes.

Ex Martis quoque
plena facie prope Solis conjunctionem, & gibbo&longs;a in quadraturis,
certum e&longs;t quod is Solem ambit.

De Jove etiam & Saturno idem
ex eorum pha&longs;ibus &longs;emper plenis demon&longs;tratur.
PHÆNOMENON IV.

Planetarum quinque primariorum, & (vel Solis circa Terram vel)
Terræ circa Solem tempora periodica e&longs;&longs;e in ratione &longs;e&longs;quipli­
cata mediocrium di&longs;tantiarum à Sole.
Hæc à Kepleroinventa ratio in confe&longs;&longs;o e&longs;t apud omnes.

Ea­
dem utique &longs;unt tempora periodica, eædemque orbium dimen­
&longs;iones, &longs;ive Sol circa Terram, &longs;ive Terra circa Solem revolvatur.
Ac de men&longs;ura quidem temporum periodieorum convenit inter
A&longs;tronomos univer&longs;os.

Magnitudines autem Orbium Keplerus&
Bullialdusomnium diligenti&longs;&longs;ime ex Ob&longs;ervationibus determina­
verunt: & di&longs;tantiæ mediocres, quæ temporibus periodicis re&longs;pon­
dent, non differunt &longs;en&longs;ibiliter à di&longs;tantiis quas illi invenerunt,
&longs;untQ.E.I.ter ip&longs;as ut plurimum intermediæ; uti in Tabula &longs;e­
quente videre licet.

row.cell: Planetarum ac Telluris di&longs;tantiæ mediocres à Sole.

p.s:
LIBER
TERTIUS.

De di&longs;tantiis Mercurii & Veneris a Sole di&longs;putandi non e&longs;t locus,
cum hæ per eorum Elongationes à Sole determinentur.

De di­
&longs;tantiis etiam &longs;uperiorum Planetarum à Sole tollitur omnis di&longs;pu­
tatio per Eclip&longs;es Satellitum Jovis.

Etenim per Eclip&longs;es illas de­
terminatur po&longs;itio umbræ quam Jupiter projicit, & eo nomine
habetur Jovis longitudo Heliocentrica.

Ex longitudinibus autem
Heliocentrica & Geocentrica inter &longs;e collatis determinatur di&longs;tan­
tia Jovis.
PHÆNOMENON V.

Planetas primarios, radiis ad Terram ductis, areas de&longs;cribere tem­
poribus minime proportionales; at radiis ad Solem ductis, areas
temporibus proportionales percurrere.

Nam re&longs;pectu Terræ nunc progrediuntur, nunc &longs;tationarii &longs;unt,
nunc etiam regrediuntur: At Solis re&longs;pectu &longs;emper progrediuntur,
idque propemodum uniformi cum motu, &longs;ed paulo celerius tamen
in Periheliis ac tardius in Apheliis, &longs;ic ut arearum æquabilis &longs;it de­
&longs;criptio.

Propo&longs;itio e&longs;t A&longs;tronomis noti&longs;&longs;ima, & in Jove apprime
demon&longs;tratur per Eclip&longs;es Satellitum, quibus Eclip&longs;ibus Helio­
centricas Planetæ hujus longitudines & di&longs;tantias à Sole determi­
nari diximus.
PHÆNOMENON VI.

Lunam radio ad centrum Terræ ducto, aream tempori proporti­
onalem de&longs;cribere.

Patet ex Lunæ motu apparente cum ip&longs;ius diametro apparente
collato.

Perturbatur autem motus Lunaris aliquantulum à vi So­
lis, &longs;ed errorum in&longs;en&longs;ibiles minutias in hi&longs;ce Phænomenis negligo.

PROPOSITIONES.
PROPOSITIO I. THEOREMA I.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE

Vires, quibus Planetæ Circumjoviales perpetuo retrahuntur à me­
tibus rectilineis & in Orbibus &longs;uis retinentur, re&longs;picere cen­
trum Jovis, & e&longs;&longs;e reciproce ut quadrata di&longs;tantiarum loco­
rum ab eodem centro.

PAtet pars prior Propo&longs;itionis per Phænomenon primum, &
Propo&longs;itionem &longs;ecundam vel tertiam Libri primi: & pars
po&longs;terior per Phænomenon primum, & Corollarium &longs;extum Pro­
po&longs;itionis quartæ eju&longs;dem Libri.

Idem intellige de Planetis qui Saturnum comitantur, per Phæ­
nomenon &longs;ecundum.
PROPOSITIO II. THEOREMA II.

Vires, quibus Planetæ primarii perpetuo retrahuntur à motibus
rectilineis, & in Orbibus &longs;uis retinentur, re&longs;picere Solem, &
e&longs;&longs;e reciproce ut quadrata di&longs;tantiarum ab ip&longs;ius centro.

Patet pars prior Propo&longs;itionis per Phænomenon quintum, &
Propo&longs;itionem &longs;ecundam Libri primi: & pars po&longs;terior per Phæ­
nomenon quartum, & Propo&longs;itionem quartam eju&longs;dem Libri.
Accurati&longs;&longs;ime autem demon&longs;tratur hæc pars Propo&longs;itionis per
quietem Apheliorum.

Nam aberratio quam minima à ratione
duplicata (per Corol. 1. Prop. XLV. Lib. I.) motum Ap&longs;idum in
&longs;ingulis revolutionibus notabilem, in plunibus enormem efficere
deberet.
PROPOSITIO III. THEOREMA III.

LIBER
TERTIUS.

Vim qua Luna retinetur in Orbe &longs;uo re&longs;picere Terram, & e&longs;&longs;e re­
citroce ut quadratum di&longs;tantiæ loeorum ab ip&longs;ius centro.

Patet a&longs;&longs;ertionis pars prior per Phænomenon &longs;extum, & Propo­
po&longs;itionem &longs;ecundam vel tertiam Libri primi: & pars po&longs;terior
per motum tardi&longs;&longs;imum Lunaris Apogæi.

Nam motus ille, qui
&longs;ingulis revolutionibus e&longs;t graduum tantum trium & minutorum
trium in con&longs;equentia, contemni pote&longs;t.

Patet enim (per Corol. 1.
Prop. XLV. Lib.I.) quod &longs;i di&longs;tantia Lunæ a centro Terræ &longs;it ad
&longs;emidiametrum Terræ ut D ad 1; vis a qua motus talis oriatur &longs;it
reciproce ut D (2 4/243), id e&longs;t, reciproce ut ea ip&longs;ius D dignitas cu­
jus index e&longs;t (2 4/243), hoc e&longs;t, in ratione di&longs;tantiæ paulo majore quam
duplicata inver&longs;e, &longs;ed quæ partibus 59 1/4 propius ad duplicatam
quam ad triplicatam accedit.

Oritur vero ab actione Solis (uti
po&longs;thac dicetur) & propterea hic negligendus e&longs;t.

Actio Solis
quatenus Lunam di&longs;trahit a Terra, e&longs;t ut di&longs;tantia Lunæ a Terra
quamproxime; ideoque (per ea quæ dicuntur in Corol. 2. Prop.
XLV. Lib. I.) e&longs;t ad Lunæ vim centripetam ut 2 ad 357,45 circi­
ter, &longs;eu 1 ad (178 29/40). Et neglecta Solis vi tantilla, vis reliqua qua
Luna retinetur in Orbe erit reciproce ut D2. Id quod etiam
plenius con&longs;tabit conferendo hanc vim cum vi gravitatis, ut fit
in Propo&longs;itione &longs;equente.

Corol.Si vis centripeta mediocris qua Luna retinetur in Orbe,
augeatur primo in ratione (177 29/40) ad (178 29/40), deinde etiam in rati­
one duplicata &longs;emidiametri Terræ ad mediocrem di&longs;tantiam centri
Lunæ a centro Terræ: habebitur vis centripeta Lunaris ad &longs;uper­
ficiem Terræ, po&longs;ito quod vis illa de&longs;cendendo ad &longs;uperficiem
Terræ, perpetuo augeatur in reciproca altitudinis ratione du­
plicata.
PROPOSITIO IV. THEOREMA IV.

Lunam gravitare in Terram, & vi gravitatis retrahi &longs;emper a
motu rectilineo, & in Orbe &longs;uo retineri.

Lunæ di&longs;tantia mediocris a Terra in Syzygiis e&longs;t &longs;emidiametro­
rum terre&longs;trium, &longs;ecundum plero&longs;que A&longs;tronomorum 59, &longs;ecun­
dum Vendelinum60, &longs;ecundum Copernicum60 1/3, & &longs;ecundum Ty-
chonem56 1/2. A&longs;t Tycho,& quotquot ejus Tabulas refractionum
&longs;equuntur, con&longs;tituendo refractiones Solis & Lunæ (omnino con­
tra naturam Lucis) majores quam Fixarum, idque &longs;crupulis qua&longs;i
quatuor vel quinque, auxerunt parallaxin Lunæ &longs;crupulis totidem,
hoc e&longs;t, qua&longs;i duodecima vel decima quinta parte totius paralla­
xeos.

Corrigatur i&longs;te error, & di&longs;tantia evadet qua&longs;i 60 1/2 &longs;emi­
diametrorum terre&longs;trium, fere ut ab aliis a&longs;&longs;ignatum e&longs;t.

A&longs;&longs;uma­
mus di&longs;tantiam mediocrem &longs;exaginta &longs;emidiametrorum; & Luna­
rem periodum re&longs;pectu Fixarum compleri diebus 27, horis 7, mi­
nutis primis 43, ut ab A&longs;tronomis &longs;tatuitur; atque ambitum Terræ
e&longs;&longs;e pedum Pari&longs;ien&longs;ium 123249600, uti a Gallismen&longs;urantibus de­
finitum e&longs;t: Et &longs;i Luna motu omni privari fingatur ac dimitti ut,
urgente vi illa omni qua in Orbe &longs;uo retinetur, de&longs;cendat in Ter­
ram; hæc &longs;patio minuti unius primi cadendo de&longs;cribet pedes Pari­
&longs;ien&longs;es (15 1/12). Colligitur hoc ex calculo vel per Propo&longs;itionem
XXXVI. Libri primi, vel (quod eodem recidit) per Corollarium
nonum Propo&longs;itionis quartæ eju&longs;dem Libri, confecto.

Nam ar­
cus illius quem Luna tempore minuti unius primi, medio &longs;uo
motu, ad di&longs;tantiam &longs;exaginta &longs;emidiametrorum terre&longs;trium de­
&longs;cribat, &longs;inus ver&longs;us e&longs;t pedum Pari&longs;ien&longs;ium (15 1/12) circiter.

Unde
cum vis illa accedendo ad Terram augeatur in duplicata di&longs;tantiæ
ratione inver&longs;a, adeoque ad &longs;uperficiem Terræ major &longs;it partibus
60X60 quam ad Lunam; corpus vi illa in regionibus no&longs;tris ca­
dendo, de&longs;cribere deberet &longs;patio minuti unius primi pedes Pari­
&longs;ien&longs;es 60X60X(15 1/12), & &longs;patio minuti unius &longs;ecundi pedes (15 1/12).
Atqui corpora in regionibus no&longs;tris vi gravitatis cadendo, de&longs;cri­
bunt tempore minuti unius &longs;ecundi pedes Pari&longs;ien&longs;es (15 1/12), uti
Hugeniusfactis pendulorum experimentis & computo inde inito,
demon&longs;travit: & propterea (per Reg. 1. & 11.) vis qua Luna in
Orbe &longs;uo retinetur, illa ip&longs;a e&longs;t quam nos Gravitatem dicere &longs;ole­
mus.

Nam &longs;i Gravitas ab ea diver&longs;a e&longs;t, corpora viribus utri&longs;que
conjunctis Terram petendo, duplo velocius de&longs;cendent, & &longs;patio
minuti unius &longs;ecundi cadendo de&longs;cribent pedes Pari&longs;ien&longs;es 30 1/6:
omnino contra Experientiam.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE
Calculus hic fundatur in hypothe&longs;i quod Terra quie&longs;cit.

Nam
&longs;i Terra & Luna circum Solem moveantur, & interea quoque cir­
cum commune gravitatis centrum revolvantur: di&longs;tantia centro­
rum Lunæ ac Terræ ab invicem erit 60 1/2 &longs;emidiametrorum ter­
re&longs;trium; uti computationem (per Prop. LX. Lib. I.) ineunti
patebit.
PROPOSITIO V. THEOREMA V.

LIBER
TERTIUS.

Planetas Circumjoviales gravitare in Jovem, Circum&longs;aturnios in
Saturnum, & Circum&longs;olares in Solem, & vi gravitatis &longs;uæ
retrahi &longs;emper à motibus rectilineis, & in Orbibus curvili­
neis retineri.

Nam revolutiones Planetarum Circumjovialium circa Jovem, Cir­
cum&longs;aturniorum circa Saturnum, & Mercurii ac Veneris reliquo­
rumque Circum&longs;olarium circa Solem &longs;unt Phænomena eju&longs;dem ge­
neris cum revolutione Lunæ circa Terram; & propterea per
Reg. 11. à cau&longs;is eju&longs;dem generis dependent: præ&longs;ertim cum de­
mon&longs;tratum &longs;it quod vires, à quibus revolutiones illæ dependent,
re&longs;piciant centra Jovis, Saturni ac Solis, & recedendo à Jove, Sa­
turno & Sole decre&longs;cant eadem ratione ac lege, qua vis gravitatis
decre&longs;cit in rece&longs;&longs;u à Terra.
Corol.1. Gravitas igitur datur in Planetas univer&longs;os.

Nam Ve­
nerem, Mercurium, cætero&longs;que e&longs;&longs;e corpora eju&longs;dem generis cum
Jove & Saturno, nemo dubitat.

Et cum attractio omnis (per mo­
tus Legem tertiam) mutua &longs;it, Jupiter in Satellites &longs;uos omnes,
Saturnus in &longs;uos, TerraQ.E.I. Lunam, & Sol in Planetas omnes
primarios gravitabit.

Corol.2. Gravitatem, quæ Planetam unumquemque re&longs;picit, e&longs;&longs;e
reciproce ut quadratum di&longs;tantiæ loeorum ab ip&longs;ius centro.

Corol.3. Graves &longs;unt Planetæ omnes in &longs;e mutuo per Corol. 1.
& 2. Et hinc Jupiter & Saturnus prope conjunctionem &longs;e invicem
attrahendo, &longs;en&longs;ibiliter perturbant motus mutuos, Sol perturbat
motus Lunares, Sol & Luna perturbant Mare no&longs;trum, ut in
&longs;equentibus explicabitur.
PROPOSITIO VI. THEOREMA VI.

Corpora omnia in Planetas &longs;ingulos gravitare, & pondera eorum
in eundem quemvis Planetam, paribus di&longs;tantiis à centro Pla­
netæ, proportionalia e&longs;&longs;e quantitati materiæ in &longs;ingulis.

De&longs;cen&longs;us gravium omnium in Terram (dempta &longs;altem inæquali
retardatione quæ ex Aeris perexigua re&longs;i&longs;tentia oritur) æqualibus
temporibus fieri, jamdudum ob&longs;ervarunt alii; & accurati&longs;&longs;ime qui­
dem notare licet æqualitatem temporum in Pendulis.

Rem tentavi
in Auro, Argento, Plumbo, Vitro, Arena, Sale communi, Ligno,
Aqua, Tritico.

Comparabam pyxides duas ligneas rotundas &
æquales.

Unam implebam Ligno, & idem Auri pondus &longs;u&longs;pende­
bam (quam potui exacte) in alterius centro o&longs;cillationis.

Pyxides
ab æqualibus pedum undecim filis pendentes, con&longs;tituebant Pen­
dula, quoad pondus, figuram, & acris re&longs;i&longs;tentiam omnino paria:
Et paribus o&longs;cillationibus, juxta po&longs;itæ, ibant una & redibant di­
uti&longs;&longs;ime.

Proinde copia materiæ in Auro (per Corol. 1. & 6. Prop.
XXIV. Lib. II.) erat ad copiam materiæ in Ligno, ut vis motricis
actio in totum Aurum ad eju&longs;dem actionem in totum Lignum; hoc
e&longs;t, ut pondus ad pondus.
Et &longs;ic in cæteris.

In corporibus eju&longs;­
dem ponderis differentia materiæ, quæ vel minor e&longs;&longs;et quam pars
mille&longs;ima materiæ totius, his experimentis manife&longs;to deprehendi
potuit.

Jam vero naturam gravitatis in Planetas eandem e&longs;&longs;e atque
in Terram, non e&longs;t dubium.

Elevari enim fingantur corpora hæc
Terre&longs;tria ad u&longs;que Orbem Lunæ, & una cum Luna motu omni
privata demitti, ut in Terram &longs;imul cadant; & per jam ante o&longs;ten&longs;a
certum e&longs;t quod temporibus æqualibus de&longs;cribent æqualia &longs;patia
cum Luna, adeoque quod &longs;unt ad quantitatem materiæ in Luna, ut
pondera &longs;ua ad ip&longs;ius pondus.

Porro quoniam Satellites Jovis
temporibus revolvuntur quæ &longs;unt in ratione &longs;e&longs;quiplicata di&longs;tanti­
arum à centro Jovis, erunt eorum gravitates acceleratrices in Jo­
vem reciproce ut quadrata di&longs;tantiarum à centro Jovis; & prop­
terea in æqualibus a Jove di&longs;tantiis, eorum gravitates acceleratrices
evaderent æquales.

Proinde temporibus æqualibus ab æqualibus
altitudinibus cadendo, de&longs;criberent æqualia &longs;patia; perinde ut fit
in gravibus, in hac Terra no&longs;tra.

Et eodem argumento Planetæ
circum&longs;olares ab æqualibus à Sole di&longs;tantiis demi&longs;&longs;i, de&longs;cen&longs;u &longs;uo
in Solem æqualibus temporibus æqualia &longs;patia de&longs;criberent.

Vires
autem, quibus corpora inæqualia æqualiter accelerantur, &longs;unt ut
corpora; hoc e&longs;t, pondera ut quantitates materiæ in Planetis.
Porro Jovis & ejus Satellitum pondera in Solem proportionalia
e&longs;&longs;e quantitatibus materiæ eorum, patet ex motu Satellitum quam
maxime regulari; per Corol. 3. Prop. LXV. Lib. I. Nam &longs;i ho­
rum aliqui magis traherentur in Solem, pro quantitate materiæ
&longs;uæ, quam cæteri: motus Satellitum (per Corol. 2. Prop. LXV.
Lib. I.) ex inæqualitate attractionis perturbarentur.

Si (paribus
à Sole di&longs;tantiis) Satelles aliquis gravior e&longs;&longs;et in Solem pro quan­
titate materiæ &longs;uæ, quam Jupiter pro quantitate materiæ &longs;uæ, in
ratione quacunQ.E.D.ta, puta dad e: di&longs;tantia inter centrum So­
lis & centrum Orbis Satellitis, major &longs;emper foret quam di&longs;tantia
inter centrum Solis & centrum Jovis in ratione &longs;ubduplicata quam
proxime; uti calculis quibu&longs;dam initis inveni.

Et &longs;i Satelles mi­
nus gravis e&longs;&longs;et in Solem in ratione illa dad e,di&longs;tantia centri
Orbis Satellitis à Sole minor foret quam di&longs;tantia centri Jovis à
Sole in ratione illa &longs;ubduplicata.

Igitur &longs;i in æqualibus à Sole
di&longs;tantiis, gravitas acceleratrix Satellitis cuju&longs;vis in Solem major
e&longs;&longs;et vel minor quam gravitas acceleratrix Jovis in Solem, parte
tantum mille&longs;ima gravitatis totius, foret di&longs;tantia centri Orbis
Satellitis à Sole major vel minor quam di&longs;tantia Jovis à Sole
parte (7/2000) di&longs;tantiæ totius, id e&longs;t, parte quinta di&longs;tantiæ Satellitis
extimi à centro Jovis: Quæ quidem Orbis eccentricitas foret &c. valde
&longs;en&longs;ibilis.

Sed Orbes Satellitum &longs;unt Jovi concentrici, & propte­
rea gravitates acceleratrices Jovis & Satellitum in Solem æquantur
inter &longs;e.

Et eodem argumento pondera Saturni & Comitum ejus
in Solem, in æqualibus à Sole di&longs;tantiis, &longs;unt ut quantitates mate­
riæ in ip&longs;is: Et pondera Lunæ ac Terræ in Solem vel nulla &longs;unt,
vel earum ma&longs;&longs;is accurate proportionalia.

Aliqua autem &longs;unt per
Corol. 1. & 3. Prop. V.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE

LIBER
TERTIUS.

Quinetiam pondera partium &longs;ingularum Planetæ cuju&longs;Q.E.I.
alium quemcunque, &longs;unt inter &longs;e ut materia in partibus &longs;ingulis.
Nam &longs;i partes aliquæ plus gravitarent, aliæ minus, quam pro quan­
titate materiæ: Planeta totus, pro genere partium quibus maxime
abundet, gravitaret magis vel minus quam pro quantitate materiæ
totius.

Sed nec refert utrum partes illæ externæ &longs;int vel internæ.
Nam &longs;i verbi gratia corpora Terre&longs;tria, quæ apud nos &longs;unt, in
Orbem Lunæ elevari fingantur, & conferantur cum corporo Lunæ:
Si horum pondera e&longs;&longs;ent ad pondera partium externarum Lunæ
ut quantitates materiæ in ii&longs;dem, ad pondera vero partium in­
ternarum in majori vel minori ratione, forent eadem ad pondus
Lunæ totius in majori vel minori ratione: contra quam &longs;upra
o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t.

Corol.1. Hinc pondera corporum non pendent ab eorum for­
mis & texturis.

Nam &longs;i cum formis variari po&longs;&longs;ent; forent ma­
jora vel minora, pro varietate formarum, in æquali materia: om­
nino contra Experientiam.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE

Corol.2. Corpora univer&longs;a quæ circa Terram &longs;unt, gravia &longs;unt
in Terram; & pondera omnium, quæ æqualiter à centro Terræ
di&longs;tant, &longs;unt ut quantitates materiæ in ii&longs;dem.

Hæc e&longs;t qualitas
omnium in quibus experimenta in&longs;tituere licet, & propterea per
Reg.111. de univer&longs;is affirmanda e&longs;t.

Si Æther aut corpus aliud
quodcunque vel gravitate omnino de&longs;titueretur, vel pro quantitate
materiæ &longs;uæ minus gravitaret: quoniam id (ex mente Ari&longs;totelis,
Carte&longs;ii & aliorumnon differet ab aliis corporibus ni&longs;i in forma
materiæ, po&longs;&longs;et idem per mutationem formæ gradatim tran&longs;mutari
in corpus eju&longs;dem conditionis cum iis quæ, pro quantitate materiæ,
quam maxime gravitant, & vici&longs;&longs;im corpora maxime gravia, fer­
mam illius gradatim induendo, po&longs;&longs;ent gravitatem &longs;uam gradatim
amittere.

Ac proinde pondera penderent à formis corporum,
po&longs;&longs;entque cum formis variari, contra quam probatum e&longs;t in
Corollario &longs;uperiore.
Corol.3. Spatia omnia non &longs;unt æqualiter plena.

Nam &longs;i &longs;patia
omnia æqualiter plena e&longs;&longs;ent, gravitas &longs;pecifica fluidi quo regio
aeris impleretur, ob &longs;ummam den&longs;itatem materiæ, nil cederet gra­
vitati &longs;pecificæ argenti vivi, vel auri, vel corporis alterius cuju&longs;­
cunQ.E.D.n&longs;i&longs;&longs;imi; & propterea nec aurum neque aliud quod­
cunque corpus in aere de&longs;cendere po&longs;&longs;et.

Nam corpora in flui­
dis, ni&longs;i &longs;pecifice graviora &longs;int, minime de&longs;cendunt.

Quod &longs;i
quantitas materiæ in &longs;patio dato per rarefactionem quamcunque
diminui po&longs;&longs;it, quidni diminui po&longs;&longs;it in infinitum?

Corol.4. Si omnes omnium corporum particulæ &longs;olidæ &longs;int eju&longs;­
dem den&longs;itatis, neque ab&longs;que poris rarefieri po&longs;&longs;int, Vacuum da­
tur.

Eju&longs;dem den&longs;itatis e&longs;&longs;e dico, quarum vires inertiæ &longs;unt ut
magnitudines.
Corol.5. Vis gravitatis diver&longs;i e&longs;t generis à vi magnetica.

Nam
attractio magnetica non e&longs;t ut materia attracta.

Corpora aliqua
magis trahuntur, alia minus, plurima non trahuntur.

Et vis mag­
netica in uno & eodem corpore intendi pote&longs;t & remitti, e&longs;tque
nonnunquam longe major pro quantitate materiæ quam vis gra­
vitatis, & in rece&longs;&longs;u à Magnete decre&longs;cit in ratione di&longs;tantiæ non
duplicata, &longs;ed fere triplicata, quantum ex cra&longs;&longs;is quibu&longs;dam ob&longs;er­
vationibus animadvertere potui.
PROPOSITIO VII. THEOREMA VII.

LIBER
TERTIUS.

Gravitatem in corpora univer&longs;a fieri, eamque proportionalem e&longs;&longs;e
quantitati materiæ in &longs;ingulis.

Planetas omnes in &longs;e mutuo graves e&longs;&longs;e jam ante probavimus,
ut & gravitatem in unumquemque &longs;eor&longs;im &longs;pectatum e&longs;&longs;e reci­
proce ut quadratum di&longs;tantiæ loeorum à centro Planetæ. Et inde
con&longs;equens e&longs;t, (per Prop. LXIX. Lib. I. & ejus Corollaria) gra­
vitatem in omnes proportionalem e&longs;&longs;e materiæ in ii&longs;dem.

Porro cum Pianetæ cuju&longs;vis Apartes omnes graves &longs;int in Pla­
netam quemvis B,& gravitas partis cuju&longs;que &longs;it ad gravitatem
totius, ut materia partis ad materiam totius, & actioni omni re­
actio (per motus Legem tertiam) æqualis &longs;it; Planeta Bin partes
omnes Planetæ Avici&longs;&longs;im gravitabit, & erit gravitas &longs;ua in par­
tem unamquamque ad gravitatem &longs;uam in totum, ut materia par­
tis ad materiam totius. Q.E.D.

Corol.1. Oritur igitur & componitur gravitas in Planetam to­
tum ex gravitate in partes &longs;ingulas.

Cujus rei exempla habemus
in attractionibus Magneticis & Electricis.

Oritur enim attractio
omnis in totum ex attractionibus in partes &longs;ingulas.

Res intelli­
getur in gravitate, concipiendo Planetas plures minores in unum
Globum coire & Planetam majorem componere.

Nam vis totius
ex viribus partium componentium oriri debebit.

Siquis objiciat
quod corpora omnia, quæ apud nos &longs;unt, hac lege gravitare de­
berent in &longs;e mutuo, cum tamen cju&longs;modi gravitas neutiquam &longs;en­
tiatur: Re&longs;pondeo quod gravitas in hæc corpora, cum &longs;it ad gra­
vitatem in Terram totam ut &longs;unt hæc corpora ad Terram totam,
longe minor e&longs;t quam quæ &longs;entiri po&longs;&longs;it.

Corol.2. Gravitatio in &longs;ingulas corporis particulas æquales e&longs;t
reciproce ut quadratum di&longs;tantiæ loeorum à particulis.

Patet per
Corol. 3. Prop. LXXIV. Lib. I.
PROPOSITIO VIII. THEOREMA VIII.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE

Si Globorum duorum in &longs;e mutuo gravitantium materia undique,
in regionibus quæ à centris æqualiter di&longs;tant, homogenea &longs;it:
erit pondus Globi alterutrius in alterum reciproce ut quadra­
tum di&longs;tantiæ inter centra.

Po&longs;tquam inveni&longs;&longs;em gravitatem in Planetam totum oriri &
componi ex gravitatibus in partes; & e&longs;&longs;e in partes &longs;ingulas reci­
proce proportionalem quadratis di&longs;tantiarum a partibus: dubita­
bam an reciproca illa proportio duplicata obtineret accurate in vi
tota ex viribus pluribus compo&longs;ita, an vero quam proxime.

Nam
fieri po&longs;&longs;et ut proportio, quæ in majoribus di&longs;tantiis &longs;atis accu­
rate obtineret, prope &longs;uperficiem Planetæ ob inæquales particu­
larum di&longs;tantias & &longs;itus di&longs;&longs;imiles, notabiliter erraret.

Tandem
vero, per Prop. LXXV. & LXXVI. Libri primi & ip&longs;arum Corol­
laria, intellexi veritatem Propo&longs;itionis de qua hic agitur.

Corol.1. Hinc inveniri & inter &longs;e comparari po&longs;&longs;unt pondera
corporum in diver&longs;os Planetas.

Nam pondera corporum æqua­
lium circum Planetas in circulis revolventium &longs;unt (per Corol. 2.
Prop. IV. Lib.I.) ut diametri circulorum directe & quadrata tem­
porum periodieorum inver&longs;e; & pondera ad &longs;uperficies Planeta­
rum, alia&longs;ve qua&longs;vis a centro di&longs;tantias, majora &longs;unt vel minora
(per hanc Propo&longs;itionem) in duplicata ratione di&longs;tantiarum in­
ver&longs;a. Sic ex temporibus periodicis Veneris circum Solem die­
rum 224 & horarum 16 1/4, Satellitis extimi circumjovialis circum
Jovem dierum 16 & horarum (16 1/15), Satellitis Hugeniani circum
Saturnum dierum 15 & horarum 22 2/3, & Lunæ circum Terram
dierum 27, hor. 7. min. 43, collatis cum di&longs;tantia mediocri Vene­
ris a Sole & cum elongationibus maximis heliocentricis Satellitis
extimi circumjovialis a centro Jovis 8′. 21 1/2″, Satellitis Hugeniani
a centro Saturni 3′. 20″, & Lunæ a Terra 10′, computum ineundo
inveni quod corporum æqualium & a Sole, Jove, Saturno ac Terra
æqualiter di&longs;tantium pondera in Solem, Jovem, Saturnum ac Ter­
ram forent ad invicem ut 1, (1/1033), (1/2411), & (1/227512) re&longs;pective.

E&longs;t enim
parallaxis Solis ex ob&longs;ervationibus novi&longs;&longs;imis qua&longs;i 10″, & Hal­
leiusno&longs;ter per emer&longs;iones Jovis & Satellitum e parte ob&longs;cura
Lunæ, determinavit quod elongatio maxima heliocentrica Satelli­
tis extimi Jovialis a centro Jovis in mediocri Jovis a Sole di&longs;tan­
tia &longs;it 8′. 21 1/2″, & diameter Jovis 41″. Ex duratione Eclip&longs;eon
Satellitum in umbram Jovis incidentium prodit hæc diameter
qua&longs;i 40″, atque adeo &longs;emidiameter 20″. Men&longs;uravit autem Hu­
geniuselongationem maximam heliocentricam Satellitis a &longs;e de­
tecti 3′. 20″ a centro Saturni, & hujus elongationis pars quarta,
nempe 50″, e&longs;t diameter annuli Saturni e Sole vi&longs;i, & diameter Sa­
turni e&longs;t ad diametrum annuli ut 4 ad 9, ideoque &longs;emidiameter
Saturni e Sole vi&longs;i e&longs;t 11″. Subducatur lux erratica quæ haud
minor e&longs;&longs;e &longs;olet quam 2″ vel 3″: Et manebit &longs;emidiameter Saturni
qua&longs;i 9″. Ex hi&longs;ce autem & Solis &longs;emidiametro mediocri 16′. 6″
computum ineundo prodeunt veræ Solis, Jovis, Saturni ac Terræ
&longs;emidiametri ad invicem ut 10000, 1077, 889 & 104. Unde,
cum pondera æqualium corporum 2 centris Solis, Jovis, Saturni
ac Terræ æqualiter di&longs;tantium, &longs;int in Solem, Jovem, Saturnum
ac Terram, ut 1, (1/1033), (1/2411), & (1/227512) re&longs;pective, & auctis vel dimi­
nutis di&longs;tantiis pondera diminuantur vel augeantur in duplicata
ratione: pondera æqualium corporum in Solem, Jovem, Satur­
num ac Terram in di&longs;tantiis 10000, 1077, 889, & 104 ab eorum
centris, atque adeo in eorum &longs;uperficiebus, erunt ut 10000, 835,
525, & 410 re&longs;pective.

Quanta &longs;int pondera corporum in &longs;uper­
ficie Lunæ dicemus in &longs;equentibus.

LIBER
TERTIUS.

Corol.2. Innote&longs;cit etiam quantitas materiæ in Planetis &longs;ingulis.
Nam quantitates materiæ in Planetis &longs;unt ut eorum vires in æqua­
libus di&longs;tantiis ab eorum centris, id e&longs;t, in Sole, Jove, Saturno ac
Terra &longs;unt ut 1, (1/1033), (1/2411), & (1/227512) re&longs;pective.

Si parallaxis Solis
&longs;tatuatur major vel minor quam 10″, debebit quantitas materiæ in
Terra augeri vel diminui in triplicata ratione.
Corol.3. Innote&longs;cunt etiam den&longs;itates Planetarum.

Nam pon­
dera corporum æqualium & homogeneorum in Sphæras homoge­
neas &longs;unt in &longs;uperficiebus Sphærarum ut Sphærarum diametri, per
Prop. LXXII. Lib. I. ideoque Sphærarum heterogenearum den&longs;i­
tates &longs;unt ut pondera illa applicata ad Sphærarum diametros.
Erant autem veræ Solis, Jovis, Saturni ac Terræ diametri ad invi­
cem ut 10000, 1077, 889, & 104, & pondera in eo&longs;dem ut 10000,
835, 525, & 410, & propterea den&longs;itates &longs;unt ut 100, 78, 59,
& 396. Den&longs;itas Terræ quæ prodit ex hoc computo non pendet
a parallaxi Solis, &longs;ed determinatur per parallaxin Lunæ, & prop­
terea hic recte definitur.

E&longs;t igitur Sol paulo den&longs;ior quam Jupi­
ter, & Jupiter quam Saturnus, & Terra quadruplo den&longs;ior quam
Sol.
Nam per ingentem &longs;uum calorem Sol rare&longs;cit.

Luna vero
den&longs;ior e&longs;t quam Terra, ut in &longs;equentibus patebit.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE

Corol.4. Den&longs;iores igitur &longs;unt Planetæ qui &longs;unt minores, cæ­
teris paribus.

Sic enim vis gravitatis in eorum &longs;uperficiebus ad
æqualitatem magis accedit.

Sed & den&longs;iores &longs;unt Planetæ, cæte­
ris paribus, qui &longs;unt Soli propiores; ut Jupiter Saturno, & Terra
Jove.

In diver&longs;is utiQ.E.D.&longs;tantiis a Sole collocandi erant Planetæ
ut quilibet pro gradu den&longs;itatis calore Solis majore vel minore
frueretur.

Aqua no&longs;tra, &longs;i Terra locaretur in orbe Saturni, rige­
&longs;ceret, &longs;i in orbe Mercurii in vapores &longs;tatim abiret.

Nam lux
Solis, cui calor proportionalis e&longs;t, &longs;eptuplo den&longs;ior e&longs;t in orbe
Mercurii quam apud nos: & Thermometro expertus &longs;um quod
&longs;eptuplo Solis æ&longs;tivi calore aqua ebullit.

Dubium vero non e&longs;t
quin materia Mercurii ad calorem accommodetur, & propterea
den&longs;ior &longs;it hac no&longs;tra; cum materia omnis den&longs;ior ad operationes
Naturales obeundas majorem calorem requirat.
PROPOSITIO IX. THEOREMA IX.

Gravitatem pergendo a &longs;uperficiebus Planetarum deor&longs;um de­
cre&longs;cere in ratione di&longs;tantiarum a centro quam proxime.

Si materia Planetæ quoad den&longs;itatem uniformis e&longs;&longs;et, obtineret
hæc Propo&longs;itio accurate: per Prop. LXXIII. Lib. I. Error igitur
tantus e&longs;t, quantus ab inæquabili den&longs;itate oriri po&longs;&longs;it.
PROPOSITIO X. THEOREMA X.
Motus Planetarum in Cœlis diuti&longs;&longs;ime con&longs;ervari po&longs;&longs;e.

In Scholio Propo&longs;itionis XL. Lib. II. o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t quod globus
Aquæ congelatæ in Aere no&longs;tro, libere movendo & longitudinem
&longs;emidiametri &longs;uæ de&longs;cribendo, ex re&longs;i&longs;tentia Aeris amitteret motus
&longs;ui partem (1/4586). Obtinet autem eadem proportio quam proxime
in globis utcunque magnis & velocibus.

Jam vero Globum Terræ
no&longs;træ den&longs;iorem e&longs;&longs;e quam &longs;i totus ex Aqua con&longs;taret, &longs;ic colligo.
Si Globue hicce totus e&longs;&longs;et aqueus, quæcunque rariora e&longs;&longs;ent quam
aqua, ob minorem &longs;pecificam gravitatem emergerent & &longs;upernata­
rent. Ea Q.E.D. cau&longs;a Globus terreus aquis undique coopertus,
&longs;i rarior e&longs;&longs;et quam aqua, emergeret alicubi, & aqua omnis inde
defluens congregaretur in regione oppo&longs;ita.

Et par e&longs;t ratio
Terræ no&longs;træ maribus magna ex parte circumdatæ. Hæc &longs;i den­
&longs;ior non e&longs;&longs;et, emergeret ex maribus, & parte &longs;ui pro gradu levi­
tatis extaret ex Aqua, maribus omnibus in regionem oppo&longs;itam
confluentibus.

Eodem argumento maculæ Solares leviores &longs;unt.
quam materia lucida Solaris cui &longs;upernatant.

Et in formatione
qualicunque Planetarum, materia omnis gravior, quo tempore
ma&longs;&longs;a tota fluida erat, centrum petebat.

Unde cum Terra com­
munis &longs;uprema qua&longs;i duplo gravior &longs;it quam aqua, & paulo infe­
rius in fodinis qua&longs;i triplo vel quadruplo aut etiam quintuplo gra­
vior reperiatur: veri&longs;imile e&longs;t quod copia materiæ totius in Terra
qua&longs;i quintuplo vel &longs;extuplo major &longs;it quam &longs;i tota ex aqua con­
&longs;taret; præ&longs;ertim cum Terram qua&longs;i quintuplo den&longs;iorem e&longs;&longs;e
quam Jovem jam ante o&longs;ten&longs;um &longs;it.

Igitur &longs;i Jupiter paulo den­
&longs;ior &longs;it quam aqua, hic &longs;patio dierum triginta, quibus lon­
gitudinem 459 &longs;emidiametrorum &longs;uarum de&longs;cribit, amitteret in
Medio eju&longs;dem den&longs;itatis cum Aere no&longs;tro motus &longs;ui partem fere
decimam.

Verum cum re&longs;i&longs;tentia Mediorum minuatur in ratione
ponderis ac den&longs;itatis, &longs;ic ut aqua, quæ partibus 13 2/3 levior e&longs;t
quam argentum vivum, minus re&longs;i&longs;tat in eadem ratione; & aer,
qui partibus 850 levior e&longs;t quam aqua, minus re&longs;i&longs;tat in eadem
ratione: &longs;i a&longs;cendatur in cœlos ubi pondus Medii, in quo Planetæ
moventur, diminuitur in immen&longs;um, re&longs;i&longs;tentia prope ce&longs;&longs;abit.
HYPOTHESIS I.
Centrum Sy&longs;tematis Mundani quie&longs;cere.

LIBER
TERTIUS.

Hoc ab omnibus conce&longs;&longs;um e&longs;t, dum aliqui Terram alii Solem
in centro Sy&longs;tematis quie&longs;cere contendant.

Videamus quid inde
&longs;equatur.
PROPOSITIO XI. THEOREMA XI.

Commune centrum gravitatis Terræ, Solis & Planetarum om­
nium quie&longs;cere.

Nam centrum illud (per Legum Corol. 4.) vel quie&longs;cet vel
progredietur uniformiter in directum.

Sed centro illo &longs;emper
progrediente, centrum Mundi quoque movebitur contra Hy­
pothe&longs;in.
PROPOSITIO XII. THEOREMA XII.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE

Solem motu perpetuo agitari, &longs;ed nunquam longe recedere a com­
muni gravitatis centro Planetarum omnium.

Nam cum (per Corol. 2. Prop. VIII.) materia in Sole &longs;it ad
materiam in Jove ut 1033 ad 1, & di&longs;tantia Jovis a Sole &longs;it ad
&longs;emidiametrum Solis in ratione paulo majore; incidet commune
centrum gravitatis Jovis & Solis in punctum paulo &longs;upra &longs;uper­
ficiem Solis.

Eodem argumento cum materia in Sole &longs;it ad ma­
teriam in Saturno ut 2411 ad 1, & di&longs;tantia Saturni a Sole &longs;it ad
&longs;emidiametrum Solis in ratione paulo minore: incidet commune
centrum gravitatis Saturni & Solis in punctum paulo infra &longs;uper­
ficiem Solis.

Et eju&longs;dem calculi ve&longs;tigiis in&longs;i&longs;tendo &longs;i Terra &
Planetæ omnes ex una Solis parte con&longs;i&longs;terent, commune omnium
centrum gravitatis vix integra Solis diametro a centro Solis di­
&longs;taret.

Aliis in ca&longs;ibus di&longs;tantia centrorum &longs;emper minor e&longs;t.
Et propterea cum centrum illud gravitatis perpetuo quie&longs;cit, Sol
pro vario Planetarum &longs;itu in omnes partes movebitur, &longs;ed à cen­
tro illo nunquam longe recedet.

Corol.Hinc commune gravitatis centrum Terræ, Solis & Pla­
netarum omnium pro centro Mundi habendum e&longs;t.

Nam cum
Terra, Sol & Planetæ omnes gravitent in &longs;e mutuo, & propte­
rea, pro vi gravitatis &longs;uæ, &longs;ecundum leges motus perpetuo agi­
tentur: per&longs;picuum e&longs;t quod horum centra mobilia pro Mundi
centro quie&longs;cente haberi nequeunt.

Si corpus illud in centro
locandum e&longs;&longs;et in quod corpora omnia maxime gravitant (uti
vulgi e&longs;t opinio) privilegium i&longs;tud concedendum e&longs;&longs;et Soli.
Cum autem Sol moveatur, eligendum erit punctum quie&longs;cens,
a quo centrum Solis quam minime di&longs;cedit, & a quo idem ad­
huc minus di&longs;cederet, &longs;i modo Sol den&longs;ior e&longs;&longs;et & major, ut
minus moveretur.
PROPOSITIO XIII. THEOREMA XIII.

LIBER
TERTIUS.

Planetæ moventur in Ellipfibus umbilicum habentibus in centro
Solis, & radiis ad centrum illud ductis areas de&longs;cribunt
temporibus proportionales.
Di&longs;putavimus &longs;upra de his motibus ex Phænomenis.

Jam cog­
nitis motuum principiis, ex his colligimus motus cœle&longs;tes a pri­
ori.

Quoniam pondera Planetarum in Solem &longs;unt reciproce ut
quadrata di&longs;tantiarum a centro Solis; &longs;i Sol quie&longs;ceret & Planetæ
reliqui non agerent in &longs;e mutuo, forent orbes eorum Elliptici,
Solem in umbilico communi habentes, & areæ de&longs;criberentur tem­
poribus proportionales (per Prop. I. & XI, & Corol. I. Prop.
XIII Lib. I.) Actiones autem Planetarum in &longs;e mutuo perexiguæ
&longs;unt (ut po&longs;&longs;int contemni) & motus Planetarum in Ellip&longs;ibus
circa Solem mobilem minus perturbant (per Prop. LXVI. Lib. I.)
quam &longs;i motus i&longs;ti circa Solem quie&longs;centem peragerentur.

Actio quidem Jovis in Saturnum non e&longs;t omnino contemnenda.
Nam gravitas in Jovem e&longs;t ad gravitatem in Solem (paribus di­
&longs;tantiis) ut 1 ad 1033; adeoQ.E.I. conjunctione Jovis & Saturni,
quoniam di&longs;tantia Saturni a Jove e&longs;t ad di&longs;tantiam Saturni a Sole
fere ut 4 ad 9, erit gravitas Saturni in Jovem ad gravitatem Sa­
turni in Solem ut 81 ad 16X1033 &longs;eu 1 ad 204 circiter.

Et
hinc oritur perturbatio orbis Saturni in &longs;ingulis Planetæ hujus
cum Jove conjunctionibus adeo &longs;en&longs;ibilis ut ad eandem A&longs;tronomi
hæreant.

Pro vario &longs;itu Planetæ in his conjunctionibus, Eccen­
tricitas ejus nunc augetur nunc diminuitur, Aphelium nunc pro­
movetur nunc forte retrahitur, & medius motus per vices accele­
ratur & retardatur.

Error tamen omnis in motu ejus circum So­
lem a tanta vi oriundus (præterquam in motu medio) evitari fere
pote&longs;t con&longs;tituendo umbilicum inferiorem Orbis ejus in communi
centro gravitatis Jovis & Solis (per Prop. LXVII. Lib. I.) & prop­
terea ubi maximus e&longs;t, vix &longs;uperat minuta duo prima. Et error
maximus in motu medio vix &longs;uperat minuta duo prima annuatim.
In conjunctione autem Jovis & Saturni gravitates acceleratrices
Solis in Saturnum, Jovis in Saturnum & Jovis in Solem &longs;unt fere
ut 16, 81 & (16X81X2411/25) &longs;eu 124986, adeoQ.E.D.fferentia gravi­
tatum Solis in Saturnum & Jovis in Saturnum e&longs;t ad gravitatem
Jovis in Solem ut 65 ad 124986 &longs;eu 1 ad 1923. Huic autem dif­
ferentiæ proportionalis e&longs;t maxima Saturni efficacia ad perturban­
dum motum Jovis, & propterea perturbatio orbis Jovialis longe
minor e&longs;t quam ea Saturnii.

Reliquorum orbium perturbationes
&longs;unt adhuc longe minores, præterquam quod Orbis Terræ &longs;en&longs;i­
biliter perturbatur a Luna.

Commune centrum gravitatis Terræ
& Lunæ, Ellip&longs;in circum Solem in umbilico po&longs;itum percurrit, &
radio ad Solem ducto areas in eadem temporibus proportionales
de&longs;cribit, Terra vero circum hoc centrum commune motu men­
&longs;truo revolvitur.
PROPOSITIO XIV. THEOREMA XIV.
Orbium Aphelia & Nodi quie&longs;cunt.

DE MUNDI
SYSTEMATE

Aphelia quie&longs;cunt, per Prop. XI. Lib. I. ut & Orbium plana,
per eju&longs;dem Libri Prop. 1. & quie&longs;centibus planis quie&longs;cunt Nodi.
Attamen a Planetarum revolventium & Cometarum actionibus in
&longs;e invicem orientur inæqualitates aliquæ, &longs;ed quæ ob parvitatem
hic contemni po&longs;&longs;unt.

Corol.1. Quie&longs;cunt etiam Stellæ fixæ, propterea quod datas ad
Aphelia Nodo&longs;que po&longs;itiones &longs;ervant.

Corol.2. Ideoque cum nulla &longs;it earum parallaxis &longs;en&longs;ibilis ex
Terræ motu annuo oriunda, vires earum ob immen&longs;am corporum
di&longs;tantiam nullos edent &longs;en&longs;ibiles effectus in regione Sy&longs;tematis
no&longs;tri.

Quinimo Fixæ in omnes cæli partes æqualiter di&longs;per&longs;æ
contrariis attractionibus vires mutuas de&longs;truunt, per Prop. LXX.
Lib. I.
Scholium.

Cum Planetæ Soli propiores (nempe Mercurius, Venus, Terra,
& Mars) ob corporum parvitatem parum agant in &longs;e invicem:
horum Aphelia & Nodi quie&longs;cent, ni&longs;i quatenus a viribus Jovis,
Saturni, & corporum &longs;uperiorum turbentur.

Et inde colligi po­
te&longs;t per theoriam gravitatis, quod horum Aphelia moventur ali­
quantulum in con&longs;equentia re&longs;pectu fixarum, idQ.E.I. proporti­
one &longs;e&longs;quiplicata di&longs;tantiarum horum Planetarum a Sole.

Ut &longs;i
Aphelium Martis in annis centum conficiat 35′ in con&longs;equentia
re&longs;pectu fixarum; Aphelia Terræ, Veneris, & Mercurii in annis
centum conficient 18′. 36″, 11′. 27″, & 4′. 29″ re&longs;pective.

Et hi
motus, ob parvitatem, negliguntur in hac Propo&longs;itione.

Invenire Orbium principales diametros.

LIBER
TERTIUS.

Capiendæ &longs;unt hæ in ratione &longs;ub&longs;e&longs;quiplicata temporum perio­
dieorum, per Prop. XV. Lib. I. deinde &longs;igillatim augendæ in rati­
one &longs;ummæ ma&longs;&longs;arum Solis & Planetæ cuju&longs;que revolventis ad
primam duarum medie proportionalium inter &longs;ummam illam &
Solem, per Prop. LX. Lib. I.
PROPOSITIO XVI. PROBLEMA II.
Invenire Orbium Eccentricitates & Aphelia.

Problema confit per Prop. XVIII. Lib. I.
PROPOSITIO XVII. THEOREMA XV.

Planetarum motus diurnos uniformes e&longs;&longs;e, & librationem Lunæ
ex ip&longs;ius motu diurno oriri.

Patet per motus Legem I, & Corol. 22. Prop. LXVI. Lib. I.
Quoniam vero Lunæ, circa axem &longs;uum uniformiter revolventis,
dies men&longs;truus e&longs;t; hujus facies eadem ulteriorem umbilicum or­
bis ip&longs;ius &longs;emper re&longs;piciet, & propterea pro &longs;itu umbilici illius
deviabit hinc inde a Terra.

Hæc e&longs;t libratio in longitudinem.
Nam libratio in latitudinem orta e&longs;t ex inclinatione axis Lunaris
ad planum orbis.

Porro hæc ita &longs;e habere, ex Phænomenis mani­
fe&longs;tum e&longs;t.
PROPOSITIO XVIII. THEOREMA XVI.

Axes Planetarum diametris quæ ad eo&longs;dem axes normaliter du­
cuntur minores e&longs;&longs;e.

Planetæ &longs;ublato omni motu circulari diurno figuram Sphæricam,
ob æqualem undique partium gravitatem, affectare deberent.

Per
motum illum circularem fit ut partes ab axe recedentes juxta
æquatorem a&longs;cendere conentur.

Ideoque materia &longs;i fluida &longs;it
a&longs;cen&longs;u &longs;uo ad æquatorem diametros adaugebit, axem vero de­
&longs;cen&longs;u &longs;uo ad polos diminuet.

Sic Jovis diameter (con&longs;entienti­
bus A&longs;tronomorum ob&longs;ervationibus) brevior deprehenditur inter
polos quam ab oriente in occidentem.

Eodem argumento, ni&longs;i
Terra no&longs;tra paulo altior e&longs;&longs;et &longs;ub æquatore quam ad polos, Ma­
ria ad polos &longs;ub&longs;iderent, & juxta æquatorem a&longs;cendendo, ibi om­
nia inundarent.

TERTIUS.

Si Planeta major &longs;it vel minor quam Terra manente ejus den­
&longs;itate ac tempore periodico revolutionis diurnæ, manebit pro­
portio vis centrifugæ ad gravitatem, & propterea manebit etiam
proportio diametri inter polos ad diametrum &longs;ecundum æquato­
rem.

At &longs;i motus diurnus in ratione quacunque acceleretur vel
retardetur, augebitur vel minuetur vis centrifuga in duplicata illa
ratione, & propterea differentia diametrorum augebitur vel mi­
nuetur in eadem duplicata ratione quamproxime.

Et &longs;i den&longs;itas
Planetæ augeatur vel minuatur in ratione quavis, gravitas etiam
in ip&longs;um tendens augebitur vel minuetur in eadem ratione, &
differentia diametrorum vici&longs;&longs;im minuetur in ratione gravitatis
auctæ vel augebitur in ratione gravitatis diminutæ. Unde cum
Terra re&longs;pectu fixarum revolvatur horis 23. 56′, Jupiter autem
horis 9. 56′, &longs;intque temporum quadrata ut 29 ad 5, & den&longs;itates
ut 5 ad 1: differentia diametrorum Jovis erit ad ip&longs;ius diame­
trum minorem ut (29/5)X(5/1)X(1/229) ad 1, &longs;eu 1 ad 8 quamproxime.

E&longs;t
igitur diameter Jovis ab oriente in occidentem ducta, ad ejus dia­
metrum inter polos ut 9 ad 8 quamproxime, & propterea diame­
ter inter polos e&longs;t 35 1/2″. Hæc ita &longs;e habent ex hypothe&longs;i quod
uniformis &longs;it Planetarum materia.

Nam &longs;i materia den&longs;ior &longs;it ad
centrum quam ad circumferentiam; diameter quæ ab oriente in
occidentem ducitur, erit adhuc major.

Jovis vero diametrum quæ polis ejus interjacet minorem e&longs;&longs;e
diametro altera Ca&longs;&longs;inusdudum ob&longs;ervavit, & Terræ diametrum
inter polos minorem e&longs;&longs;e diametro altera patebit per ea quæ
dicentur in Propo&longs;itione &longs;equente.

Pendent autem effectus Luminarium ex eorum di&longs;tantiis a Terra.

In minoribus enim di&longs;tantiis majores &longs;unt eorum effectus, in ma­
joribus minores, idQ.E.I. triplicata ratione diametrorum appa­
rentium.

Igitur Sol tempore hyberno, in Perigæo exi&longs;tens, ma­
jores edit effectus, efficitque ut æ&longs;tus in Syzygiis paulo majores
&longs;int, & in Quadraturis paulo minores (cæteris paribus) quam
tempore æ&longs;tivo; & Luna in Perigæo &longs;ingulis men&longs;ibus majores
ciet æ&longs;tus quam ante vel po&longs;t dies quindecim, ubi in Apogæo ver­
&longs;atur.

Vnde fit ut æ&longs;tus duo omnino maximi in Syzygiis con­
tinuis &longs;e mutuo non &longs;equantur.

Pendet etiam effectus utriu&longs;que Luminaris ex ip&longs;ius Declina­

Nam &longs;i Luminare in polo con­

actionis inten&longs;ione & remi&longs;&longs;ione, adeoque nullam motus recipro­
cationem cieret.

Igitur Luminaria recedendo ab æquatore polum
ver&longs;us, effectus &longs;uos gradatim amittent, & propterea minores cie­
bunt æ&longs;tus in Syzygiis Sol&longs;titialibus quam in Æquinoctialibus.

In Quadraturis autem Sol&longs;titialibus majores ciebunt æ&longs;tus quam
in Quadraturis Æquinoctialibus; eo quod Lunæ jam in æquatore
con&longs;titutæ effectus maxime &longs;uperat effectum Solis Incidunt igi­

rium, circa tempora Æquinoctii utriu&longs;que.

in Syzygiis comitatur &longs;emper minimus in Quadraturis, ut experi­
